content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
												(Note this is a long rant about this game so I wrote a little summery about the game at the bottom of this review to save your time. If you like to see the quick summery of it just scroll to the bottom (I won’t blame you….this is long….no pun intended) if you want details on what I find bad about the game than continue ahead)________________________________________________________________________________Although steam says I have w.e many hours I have I’ve played this game way before it even got to steam and when the newest character was the 4th one (Raven) and all I can say is this game is terrible (in comparison to its older version). And it’s mainly due to stupid design choices starting withPvEMainly untouched by the f***ery that is until you get to the higher levels and the divines hand comes down with a smite of a difficulty spike with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t enemies hitting with the forces of semi-trucks loaded with nukes and simply requires you to have a bunch of potions and people just to fight through one redundant dungeon to the next (btw the story is go here do it 3 times sometimes more to get a drop or some♥♥♥♥♥♥than move on to the next)PvP (The bulk of my argument cause PvE is just so boring to even talk about)Oh where do I begin....this blight on everything divine and holy is the main reason why I have issues with this game. And it starts with the claim that it’s a “Technical skill pvp" but that is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and here’s why. let’s say you’re  lvl 21 just starting to get into the ring trying to get your bearings,First match:  you'll match up with someone around your level a nice balance gameSecond match:  another match that’s balance what’s wrong with this again?Third match: ♥♥♥♥ING LVL 80 now you'd think oh no big deal surely the game auto scales us to a similar level or something to keep everything equal? Well...Your ♥♥♥♥ing wrong that bastarad lvl 80 will be dealing 80 lvl damage while you’re doing your 21 level damage so you could be great at the game and be able to out play everything your opponent does but you better have the grace of a swan and the unpredictable movements of a f***ing alpaca cause the instant that lvl 80 gets you he will steam roll your♥♥♥♥♥in a single combo...sort of like a mouse fighting a person with a nuke launcher, sure the mouse can wiggle his way around get some bites in but the second that guy pulls that trigger you better have your last will and testament cause you won’t have enough time to type the “f*** you lvl noob!!!” in your spurt of rage. Now here’s another issue in pvp and that’s the damn lag, the pvp lag is so bad you can even tell when you’re going to have to deal with it simply wait in the pvp loading screen and if someone marinates on 30% for too long guess what you have a lagger to deal with. And the reason why this is so bad is that it breaks the fundamentals of the game which is to cause a person to flinch so you can lay down your punishment, but laggers will slip out of these combos and be able to attack you causing you to flinch and letting them to combo you instead, And after a little testing the lag isnt caused by your internet but it’s the game its self that causes it (note this applies to some). For example if I pvp with my friend whos a block or so down from me no problem if I hit him he flinches everything is alright but lord help me (Or by freyja boobs *just look them up on the wiki…seriously*) if I pvp with someone who’s not even in my f**king city cause from that point lag starts to set in and it’s not your fault the game doesn’t have any dedicated servers to individual zones so your fighting people worldwide which leads to delayed reactions messing up your combos or a person would use a move a good while ago (which didn’t execute cause you hit him) but will pop out of nowhere damaging you and allowing the f**kward to roam free like a b*tch I mean bird. Oh and while we’re on the topic about breaking the fundamentals of the game, SOME OF THESE CHARACTERS ARE DESIGNED TO BREAK THEM. There are characters who have moves that put them in a super armor state which prevents flinching or it’s there damn passive (I’m looking at the damn elboy family) in conclusion screw pvp in this game period.  it’s not fun to much of the time and even without the lag the laziness to not have the game scale me and my enemy  to a f**king common level will ruin games that you could have won had the game stop being a lazy azz.Pay to win?F**kYes"Oh only thing you can do is buy costumes that’s not pay to win" --the elsword loyalist to everyone"F**k off you cheeky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥" – me to those loyalist who say the previous statement and here’s whyCostumes in the game will give your characters stats like extra health, attack speed stuff like that. The problem about that is they not only give you these stats which will offset the balance of pvp if the other person doesn’t have one of those costumes but these costumes can be thrown into anvil of f**kery  and upgraded even more. This completely causes the costumes to have more bs stat potential than anything you can get in game (watch someone try to defend that by saying how to brought it and they deserve the stat boost and blah blah blah “"F**k off you cheeky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥" ) putting this into perspective the average person would have about 5 pieces of equipment (not including accessories) now these pay to win masters would have about 11 a costume for each of the 5 pieces and hair now that’s without the damn enhancement stones which adds even more disgusting boost to the costume making your more powerful than the average player (and let’s not forget about the set boost you get adding even moreeeeeeee stats). and before you ask no there is no way to have a permeant costume in game you do get a costume but don’t get attach to it cause it will expire in about 10 days unless you buy the ♥♥♥♥ing thing note I didn’t put accessories into the count so that’s even more to deal with._____________________Summery and Conclusion_________________________________________This game is just a mess from the PvE in late game to the PvP from the beginning, PvE is the definition of insanity doing the same♥♥♥♥♥♥over and over again for something different, PvP is worked against by the core of the game in total and by the way its design. And to top it off the game is boring (mainly due to the broken PvP and redundant PvE), the only reason I really play it is because of the characters which I personally like as there really interesting due to their different job changes (think of Pokémon but when it evolves you choose from 3 different evolutions or 4 for one of the characters) there different play styles always were fun and the combo system in the game is actually really fun to play around with although it does have a learning curve but after you learn it you can do some real fun combos. But I don’t think the reason why we play games is just for one thing and I honestly will not be dropping a dime for this game in anyway shape or form cause it hasn’t earned it and instead of buying things to customize my character ( ironic how the steam page says how you can customize them as much as you want which is a bull face lie cause you need real world money and will buy a set of clothes cause of the set boost it gives) and note I have several characters to waste several bundles of dollars of several different characters is disgusting and more of a cash ♥♥♥♥♥ than evolve was at launch. If you play this game play it for the characters and to see their abilities if you find something worthwhile in it enjoy it although I don’t think it will last you a very long time .

number of helpful: 8 of 13 people (62%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
												Elsword is a Korean MMO beat 'em up in 2&1/2D. Here the player controls one out of nine (as of now) characters to level them up and defeat hordes of monsters while progressing through the story.Unfortunately, I already ran into problems at the level of trying to register an account. Apparently their confirmation emails can only reach certain domains, like GMail. Before I figured it out, however, I already linked my Steam account to the one that I couldn't activate and had to wait a few days for it to expire before being able to re-link it to a working one. During that time my enthusiasm for this game died out completely and it basically set the tone for my playthrough of this. If the creators fail on the level of account creation... That's just not a good sign.Once we enter the game, the first thing that comes to us is the fact that the English localization team decided to leave the Korean voice acting intact, which is quite unusual for most English versions of Asian games. I personally don't mind them, it's just that it was kinda hard to understand what they were actually saying, me being used more to Japanese.Speaking of that, I usually like to mod my games to some extent, so I managed to find (by complete accident) a mod which replaces the voice packs with those from different languages, so for example I could try getting Japanese ones into the game, which would keep it somewhat climactic yet I would be able to make out some words out of it... eeexcept the NA version (which is apparently the Steam one) changed the voiceover format from .wav to .ogg. For no reason.Another thing that stroke me as kind of odd is the fact that you need to name your characters. I mean, it would be okay if they were just classes to be chosen from and you could customize their appearance to some extent, but they are all named characters with unique backstories. Why do you have to call yourself something like "Eve Clone no. 99"? Why can't you just give your account as a whole a single nickname to use for all of your characters?I stretched out this rant long enough, so let's get to the main part of the review.The anime-style cell-shaded graphics look okay. They aren't anything spectacular, and can kind of make your eyes tired, especially the low-res textures. While it did take over three years for the game to leave Asia, it still came out later than for example Team Fortress 2.In the sound department, it's honestly mediocre. None of the music felt memorable to me, and you will get tired of your characters saying the same thing over and over again during their combos or victory poses.When it comes to gameplay, it's pretty much just your standard 2&1/2D beat 'em up but with RPG elements. You level up your character, your skills, obtain better gear, power it up... At level 15 you can advance into one of the three possible paths for your character, each possessing different skills and abilities, and at level 35 you can achieve the final form of your chosen path. And here's where the bad things begin to pop up: even the normal mooks are often tanky damage sponges with heavily-telegraphed attacks, turning at least the early game into a button mashing contest of you just wearing down their HP using the same combos over again. Your chances of dying at anything that isn't at least a mini-boss are basically nonexistant provided you do dodge their blows. You can use special skills which are usually very powerful hits or autocombos akin to supers from fighting games, burning MP in the process which can be gained back by hitting enemies and slowly replenishes itself over time. Also, you get only three item quickslots and four skill quickslots. You can double those amounts... by paying real money. Imagine if in an MMORPG, you had a very limited quickbar for skills and items and had to pay for another quickbar.Oh, and guess what: after reaching certain levels, you get two new skills... to choose from. Yes, you can get only one of those two. Considering you are already limited to taking a maximum of eight skills with you to any given battle, four if you didn't pay up, this kind of thing heavily limits the level of versatility your character can achieve. Of course, you can get the other skills via a different skill tree... by paying real money for it. The worst part is, it wasn't like this for six years. Only later did the creators realize that they can grab money off of that new possible restriction.Also, the costume pieces you get in this game only last so long. After that, you are switched back to regular, unimpressive, plain clothes. I dislike limited-time stuff like this in games in general, since they're just one huge bait. You get used to them, and then they are taken away, like that. If you want me to earn my cool looks later on, then don't showcase them early on, so I will actually be able to see how my character progresses from plain clothing to divine-level armor or something.The quests are also disappointing. They have the standard story dialogues, with the only difference being that your character isn't a soulless mime who just listens to what others have to say. Most of the quests are your basic "kill X enemies", "collect X items" or "beat X dungeon". Heck, some quests even outright tell you to beat the same dungeon multiple times. Let the obvious grind begin!What also bothers me is the fact that higher difficulties, for the most part, count as Numerical Hard, i.e. enemies' stats are inflated to higher levels but they fight the same way and it only takes longer to beat them down. Besides that, higher difficulties sometimes add an additional miniboss for you to fight, and that's about it.Another thing is that, despite it being technically a beat 'em up, it still has accuracy and evasion stats. Why does the RNG get to decide whether or not you hit the monster when your weapon visibly makes physical contact with it?Since this is a beat 'em up, I wanted to play it on a gamepad, but this game's support for it is honestly pretty mediocre. You still need your mouse to get through menus, and the number of skill and item quickslots (without buying the additional ones!) already exceeds the number of buttons a PS controller (which I'm using) posseses. So you'll have to reach your hand out to the keyboard often.I can't say much about PvP since I'm not interested in it, but I can already tell that it's not fun. The game allows you to take your gear and its stat boosts into PvP matches, and while it does get "normalized" to not allow min-maxers to build something ridiculously broken and impossible to counter, it doesn't apply to everything. While skill obviously allows you to overcome challenges, the gear is still an important part of it. You'd think that it being a beat 'em up will have some kind of way of purely skill-based play, at least as an option, but no.Okay, so until now it was only the negatives. What are the positives? Well... the wide variety of characters and their possible classes allow for a lot of experimentation. The bosses are still pretty fun to fight against. There is also a Stamina system which is supposed to lock your character out of dungeons for the duration of the day if their Stamina gets completely depleted, but it shouldn't happen unless you've been playing for a few hours straight. The character arts also look absolutely amazing. (Too bad they aren't nearly as detailed in the game itself.)My final verdict? The cons far outweigh the pros. There are restrictions on things that shouldn't even be restricted and certain solutions to things that are just plain stupid. I can't recommend it unless you play it more as a side thing for fun, not taking it too seriously and ignoring all of the limitations induced upon you.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												Don't let my hours fool you and my time on steam. I been playing consoles and other games for a while now and been playing non-steam version of elsword for 3 years.I just gotten me a gaming computer and gotten steam for it. Anway let me begin the review.Pros:*Have at least 3 friends to play this game with and you have a blast.*The back ground and the scenarios of the game  are soo beautiful.(it is anime base after all.)*It's classic, bring back Memories to classic gamers and there isn't that many 2D side scrollers mmo's, so if your a indie gamer kind of person and into mmo's, this game is for you.*The outfits in this game are just amazing, I love them all. You can never get tierd of changing looks and there always new ones to enjoy and like.Cons:*Mindless action- Meaning there no strategies,tacties or thinking needed to beat enemys and foes in elsword, it's all about rushing in and attacking as fast as you can with out letting the enemy or foe move an-inch in this game(like pvp), results of being to easy and finishing the duns and enemy off and not much of a challenge. Elsword doesn't have class roll's meaning any healers,tanks or supporters, everone bascially a offense char and all there class are to, but some class have very little support skill like TT  with shield and MP giving and WS the only class that have a healing skill but no one use it but hey elsword is a to easy game and you don't need it but add-ons like this is what make team work and mmo's interesting.. but oh well.*Not all costumes can be obtain easily, like ice burners, you can only get them through burning Ice burners, the problem is..it give you most useless stuff most of the time like magic stones,Advance magic stones, shards more. Those are the 3 it give more then the useful stuff like ib sets,high level accessory and +6 ammy's or more.So that means you could be spending 100$ and not get anything useful.*The Economy in this game is sooo bad, Everything is expensive, the cash shop and in-game board. A Perm outfit is 33$ and skill slot B is 9$ and a mount is 23$(for a short time after the event) so you could be spending 60$ per char or more sometime just for the small things you want. As for the in-game board..it's impossiable to get anything(For NA Elsword). A lot of people said "Well, stop complaing about the game being expensive, you can just buy it off board" but elsword in-game board for costume pieces and ib sets and rare items be over 100 mil ED and you only get 2 mil Ed per run in final region of elsword duns(Sander). So trading and and having good spending friends is your best luck in elsword NA.*The game is nothing but a RGN loot(meaning it rely to much on drop rates,random and mostly luck)there no quest in this game that just give you anything rare or worthy really...*The game is super reapetitive...(example) beat the dun on normal, oh you beat it? Good, do it again hard, now very hard, now very hard 3 times. Once you done with the quest, your only half way there to level up, so you would have to do the duns over 10-25 times(through Feita-Sander regions) it get pretty annoying and boring pretty quickly and  tiersome and it prove this game was to careless and lazy in-making for the questing system.*pvp...is the most complan thing ever in this game, it's pretty much broken and very much un-blance and very much gear-base.But I won't go into detail much sense the community it self will tell you how bad elsword pvp is.*Stamina system..idk what to say except it stupid and pretty tearing the players freedom of playing. Once it hit zero, all you can do is play pvp, stand around and talk with people and play on another char.*Sound track- The sound track in this game is so bad and boring, meh, I only like 3 and pretty much it, most people had to add custom for mods but to others, most don't.*Content- Okay they clam they have new content constantly more then other mmo's which is true, ever 2 weeks they have a new update, but reason I dislike it, cause it mostly just new ib sets, new outfits,mounts and pet to spend a lot of money on and barely anything new.*Customization-They said in the about me."Customize like crazy"but there isn't any "real" costomization at all unless"you paid for it" and"grind for it" which ever mmo have or should have so I say it's pretty misleading what they said in there advertising and about the game section.Do I recommend this game? Only if you don't mind it being nothing but a grind-fest(meaning to much farming and nothing but repetitive questing),can afford this game, you don't mind  a mmo's of picking chars you like and not create your own character , you like small and simple game that doesn't offer much contex and got good friends that willing to take time into this game, but over all I don't recommend this game. Personally I quit this game, not even void or korean server interest me much , cause of the game play it self. But sadly I still play this game only for friends reason. But once PSO2 and BNS comes to NA(there still hope for BNS for NA btw) i'm 100% done with elsword.Bonus:Is this game paid to win?It's more a mixture, half paid to win and half not.Pve:NoPvp:Seem like itThose costume and putting duel stones on them(expecially on ib sets) makes you un-stop-able plus the fact with the skill notes to boost your attack skills and able to get repair scrolls and have the extra skill slot for high advantage in pvp and most of all having those 6+ or more ammy's for high advantage for your SD and herir gear that cause pvp to be gear base expcially around S-SSS Rank.(seriously, what mmo charge extra for skill slot?).Everone have there own opiouns what they think of this game, please don't assume i'm complaing about the tiniest things in this game and wish everything to be easily handed to me for all the cons I listed have been a huge issues for years in this game.PS: If I had to reccomend better F2P anime mmo or mmorpg game's that out in Western I would say "Dragon nest, Aura Kingdom and Mabinogi" those 3 games tend to have more content and context and true "RP"  and  fair rate price in Both Western then Elsword does ;3.But I do have other to recommend but  there not out yet but coming soon.That is all and have a nice day.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Imagine a game with the potential to be a better smash bros. but gets bogged down by trash balance, poor design, korean p2w, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ customer support, overpriced cash shop, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ devs and horrible power creep.All of this is from the perspective of someone who's played thousands of hours, on steam and off steam. Never spent any money on Elsword (thank goodness.)Pros: - Core game is actually great.Cons:- Horrible balance- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and invasive anticheat (gameguard hates when you try to play other games at the same time)- Customer support is either bots, unresponsive, or tells you to reinstall the game.- PvE has more effect on PvP than actual skill (levels and grinding gear)- Cash has more effect on PvP than actual skill (buying your way to better gear)- PvE is mindless repetitive grind- Extremely pricey cash shop (ex. 30-40 dollars for a ♥♥♥♥ing costume)- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ netcode. (there's permanent desync and 0 latency compensation)- Bugs, some of which have existed for years without fix- Framerate is tied to animation speed (which is really important for hitstuns)- Framerate is capped differently on different OS (83 on win7, 75 on win8)- Win 8 has trouble running the game and has nasty input delay on top of the framerate cap- Texture quality and model quality is garbage by today's standards and especially for the amount of RAM the game uses- Massive Power Creep (new chars/classes were much better than the old ones)- Most of the PvP community think they're amazing when they're complete trash.- Ranks mean nothing due to massive inflation.- Game mechanics that reward poor play over skill (gaining more mana when getting hit rather than hitting someone, dealing damage to someone for being hit)TL;DR: Don't

												Imagine a game with the potential to be a better smash bros. but gets bogged down by trash balance, poor design, korean p2w, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ customer support, overpriced cash shop, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ devs and horrible power creep.All of this is from the perspective of someone who's played thousands of hours, on steam and off steam. Never spent any money on Elsword (thank goodness.)Pros: - Core game is actually great.Cons:- Horrible balance- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and invasive anticheat (gameguard hates when you try to play other games at the same time)- Customer support is either bots, unresponsive, or tells you to reinstall the game.- PvE has more effect on PvP than actual skill (levels and grinding gear)- Cash has more effect on PvP than actual skill (buying your way to better gear)- PvE is mindless repetitive grind- Extremely pricey cash shop (ex. 30-40 dollars for a ♥♥♥♥ing costume)- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ netcode. (there's permanent desync and 0 latency compensation)- Bugs, some of which have existed for years without fix- Framerate is tied to animation speed (which is really important for hitstuns)- Framerate is capped differently on different OS (83 on win7, 75 on win8)- Win 8 has trouble running the game and has nasty input delay on top of the framerate cap- Texture quality and model quality is garbage by today's standards and especially for the amount of RAM the game uses- Massive Power Creep (new chars/classes were much better than the old ones)- Most of the PvP community think they're amazing when they're complete trash.- Ranks mean nothing due to massive inflation.- Game mechanics that reward poor play over skill (gaining more mana when getting hit rather than hitting someone, dealing damage to someone for being hit)TL;DR: Don't

content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
												I played Elsword since sometime after Raven came about. I started playing more when Eve CBS came out. I will say Elsword has gotten better after the revamps because it allowed me the opportunity to get better faster. I still hate how long it takes to do a second class change and leveling up takes time too. It helps to get stamina potions though. I would recommend this game for those who are looking for something different, it hard for me to describe the game to be honest.  EDIT: I had to read some other reviews first to know what to talk about. I would like to let you know I haven't used any money on this game, my k-ching comes from watching videos (like 150 times, yes I counted) and the recent check in event. I get to where I am though hardword, determination and luck.First: The marriage thing, it's something for fun that's it. It can be helpful if you use your mp up fast and loose a lot of hp.Second: Add's weakness is his hp level, if he survives for a long time it's only because of his outfit, get armor piercing buffs and you should be fine. It's the same with Aishas and Renas, characters who can cause a lot of damage, but don't have a lot of hp. Third: PVP, all characters can be used, you just have to know how to use them or have a slow computer that basically allows you to get out of the way in time. Also use skills that you use best, the guides people post are good, but if you don't know how to properly use a skill then don't waste your sp on it, I know, I learned the hard way.Fourth: The Item Shop, it's extra, that's it. I reason with myself that if I can't play a character well then I shoudn't spend money on it because I'll eventually delete it, so only use money if you really want to on a character you're going to keep, otherwise stop complaining about, I find it gets you no where.Other: The game is free to play if and only if you bother to practice, you have to fail to get better, so just keep playing to get better, it may seem hard and it will take some time to perfect your character, but at least you can be proud of yourself for a character you made out of hardword, determination and passion for the game you play. They will always be something you may not like about a game, but don't quit because of those little things, because one day the game may change and you may miss out on something you would have benefited from.

												The game seems to have problems with itself. It have X trap software to prevent cheating... but it also prevent using hotkeys on gaming keyboards (like changing the music volume) I couldn't change volume in windows volume control too. Sometimes It is licking up even UI in the game itself, so I cannot change anything, or in some examples I cannot move my character... why so much security in such simple silly game? Also our accounts are -banned- on elsword forum as far as we are from steam. and I cannot see content of the forums beacuse of that.. The Game also tends to randomly crash and says nothing why or what happened , it just goes off puff.It looks like community in this game is dying, lesss and less people are playing it. Maybe beacuse of the issues that I mentioned. The game may be worth trying it for fun since it is free, however I do not like the  fact that I am not trusted by such a silly game and there is invasive software installed with it that is preventing me from controlling my computer fully. including shortcuts like alt+f4 .. really? wtf game?    Try to play Planet side 2, and see greatest battles in HUGE community with plenty servers and support.. and guess what? no invasive software...  in the end :   + fast gameplay + easy interface + hack & slash - invasive software (x trap)- crashing randomly with no apologies or error message- repetetive quests, very annoying after some time- animations and text appering when our character is speking in some foreign language - is translated into engilsh text but the text is just flashing like 100 words per two seconds, unreadable to any human being..  - boss animations sometimes cause game to crash- the game level does not chagne in dungeons when there is more people, it is just quicker- the drop rate is not explained how it works - very little info in the internet about anytihng about this game in english

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												The game has an EXCELLENT story, but only if you take the time to read the "cutscenes". I love the variety of characters and their job paths which all are fun to play and have great backstories.I would love to give it a Positive Review, but sadly the Cons outweigh the Pros.Pros:> Beautiful storyline> Characters have interesting backstory and personalities> Tons of character classes to play, different from one another in play style and looks> Dungeon maps are versatile, pretty, and not flat> Community is mostly friendly (outside of PVP)> Not much thinking is involved for PVE until later dungeons> It gets more strategic in the endgame dungeons (but not by that much)Cons:> No tutorial for your specific character/class. You have to eventually (if ever) figure out your character system on your own.> Pay to look good (customization) which also leads to:> Pay-to-Win skins and accessories, and utilities. You need money to get more skill slots. The skins cost either real money, or lots of in-game money because of:> THE SUPER BROKEN ECONOMY. Where you really can't make much until endgame levels.> SUPER GRINDY. You have to do the same dungeons over and over again because of level restrictions starting around late level 40s.> Unfair prize gambling system for $1 per try. If you don't buy skins off other players with in-game money, you have to buy items that have a CHANCE to give you a skin. They don't say what those chances are though. Most of the time, it gives you stuff you can cheaply buy with in-game money.> Want good PVP gear? Grind for it.> Events are terrible. You either need to grind for something, run a dungeon a certain number of times, or just WAIT 10-60 MINUTES FOR AN EVENT REWARD and you can't switch or log out otherwise the timer resets. All just for a crappy reward that usually has a 15-day expiration.> No specific roles like Tank, DPS, Healer, Support, only DPS DPS DPS DPS DPS. Which can be positive/negative depending on preference. I enjoy a bit more strategy involved.> Hackers. I didn't run into many of them in PVP, but once you do, it's annoying because it's random ranked match-ups for PVP, so they can keep matching with you.It was fun to play for a while, but then you notice the grind, the salt, the expensive items, the pay-to-win system, the time you spent waiting for that laggy person in dungeons that prevent you from proceeding unless everyone is with you, etc. etc. I had to research to figure my characters and abilities, with no tutorial for it at all in the game.It was fun while it lasted. So long Elsword. I'll read your beautiful storyline updates on the community-run wiki.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
												I have played this game quite a bit with the non-Steam version of it, and I have to say at its heart it is a good game. However, it is also a terrible game, that you shouldn't play on the NA (North American) Server, but on the KR (Korean) Server due to some major issues with the NA server that will never ever be fixed. To be at least able to run dungeons to your fullest potential later on, you must at least invest 9$ to gain access to 4 extra skill slots, because without you will only be able to used 4 skills opposed to a grand total of 8 with the B slot (Skill Slot B). To be able to compete in combat against other players when your character reaches a high level, you must at least invest around 30$ generally, this will cover the B slot so you can use your character to its fullest potential (9$), a costume to wear and enchant for stats that are needed to compete without being at a disadvantage (20$ total for a PERMANENT -not 30 day duration- hair, top piece -shirt-, bottom piece -pants-, gloves, and shoes). Do not say that you can use the so-called "Free-KChing (Premium currency used to purchase B-slot and costumes amongst many other things that are sort of required to get the most out of this game)" surveys to get all of your KChing, because each survey has a 5% chance of working and can't actually be relied on to pay off the cost of fully enjoying this game. Also, even if you do pay the 30$ (or 40$ for things that help a good amount like necklaces, or trinkets, and skill notes that make otherwise sub-par skills very good), you will never be able to get rid of the lag in pvp that ruins the fun of quite a bit of your matches (especially if you are Eve, the Nasod Queen character, because she is what is called lag-sensitive meaning that lag is more likely to brush off the hit your character does, like for example you stab someone in game and lag interferes, they might take damage, but they won't react to your stab and your opponent can hit you and knock you back; leaving you open for an attack, even though you hit first. -Which happens quite often-) Your 30-40$ also will never cure the horrible community that will rage at your for playing certain characters they find are OP even though they probably aren't. Nor will it cure the amount of boring grind you will have to do (expect to pay 4-10$ on instantly completing quests for say a job advancement which is more than nessecary, or unlocking a good skill if you don't want to waste 30 hours doing that). Also if you mess up allocating skills, and you've used up the two temporary skill resets the game gives you upon class advancements it will cost _20_ dollars to get a new one. Then comes the games economy where EVERYTHING, is expensive. You may buy premium costumes for ED (in-game currency gained by completing dungeons), but this is unrealistic. You will be paying around 1 billion ED for a 20$ costume with this current economy's rate (50,000,000 -50m or 50 million- ED for every 100 KChing, equating to 1,000,000,000 -1bil or 1 billion which takes nearly forever to make without paying- ED for 2,000 KChing), and you may not buy Skill Slot B in-game with ED, or you risk account bans and unprotected trading, resulting in scamming (when a player doesn't pay you or give you the item you paid for). Because although KC (Killer Combo, this games publisher in NA) may punish players for scamming you if you video record your transactions (even though you won't get your deserved goods or ED), Skill Slot B is not giftable which is the method for trading item mall (where you spend your KChing and buy Skill Slot B and/or costumes) merchandise that is not costumes, for costumes can be traded (but other items can not be, meaning you can be scammed, because you can pay your ED hoping they will gift your item to you, but they might just leave, meaning you won't get your item, regardless of if you report with video evidence of scamming or not. tl;dr But if you want to play this game, just play it on the KR sever, EVERYTHING IS BETTER AND YOU WILL NOT SUFFER EVEN THOUGH YOU WILL HAVE TO KNOW KOREAN OR GET AN ENGLISH PATCH. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THE NORTH AMERICAN SERVER OR YOU WILL WASTE UNNECSSARY TIME AND MONEY IN COPIOUS AMOUNTS.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 15, 2013
												Elsword is sort of like a 3D Maple Story in it's own way. So if you enjoyed that, you might like this.From the begining it can get qutie repititve really fast. It's not like most MMOs where you have an abundance of quests to do, rather, you only get a few quests per level. This can get pretty frustrating past level 40, as it forces you to either dungeon grind or field grind (Fields are areas with monsters that you can do repeat quests over and over. It's very stamina efficenet on weekdays, and gives a fair amount of xp.) Ereda Island is also a nice alternative if you're looking for PVE mixed with PVP. It's stamina efficent and it gives good exp.This game does have a stamina system. When you run out of stamina, you can no longer dungeon or gain exp from monsters in field. While most would be turned off by this, I personally don't find myself ever running out of stamina. This might be because I enjoy playing plenty of characters though, so I switch often. On weekends, stamina is unlimited. I can't really think of many things that are bad about Elsword, persay. Some would call it pay2win, due to the only way you can aquire costumes and such is through the cash shop. Plenty of players are able to play with no trouble and never spend a dime on the game. I have personally cashed, but I do remember what it was like not to cash as well. Not being able to cash limits some things, but I wouldn't say by much. You could also buy KC (The cash shop currency) from other players, but our economy is quite terrible right now so that may not be an option. Whether you cash or not does not limit your ability though, and those who think like that are silly. I think PVP is the one reason why I think this game is great. The combo system and how everything works together is very interesting. Unfortunately, many people are quite rude in PVP and those who are considered the top players have a large ego. Prepare for the salt if you decide to PVP. (I do not recommend PVPing before at LEAST 45 if you decide to, due to level differences. If you choose to PVP before then is at your own risk.)http://elwiki.net/ is a great place for game information if you're looking to have questions answered. You can always try the game's forums as well. People are usually kind there, just be careful on how you word things.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
												Want a mount permanantly? You need money. You want a  bigger inventory? You need money. You want to get married? You need money. You want a costume? You need money. Want to open certain items that monster drop? You need money. Want another pet? You need money. Accidentally put skill points into the wrong skill? You need money. You want extra slots for skills? You need money. You want a avatar? You need money. Other than the fact that the people behind this game are as greedy as a fat kid in a Golden Coral, it is an ok game and the only reason why I am saying that is because its a *clears throat and puts up finger for air quotes* "f2p". Would I reccomend? Matters do you want to get pressured into buying♥♥♥♥♥♥for this game. Believe it or not, the cheapest costume if you want it permanantly cost $30+(If you want the wings and tail). PvP is straight garbage. The PvP doesnt even attempt to match people of the same level (I can not tell you how many times I tried to PvP as a Lvl 20 and get put up against a Lvl 45+). The PvP is pretty much who ever starts there combo first wins. Dungeons, all you pretty much have to do is run through them with a mount and you will get an ss on everything (Also when you are on a mount, you are invincible). That an the fact that all bosses pretty much do is spam special attacks *cough cough* Wall No. 8.  Some of the platforms are hollow so expect to jump up to a platform and it will not catch you. For a game that begs for money for anything extra, it sure doesn't do a good job polishing it. If I was a dev for this game, I would be updating this game at least once a week, this game needs some work, badly. Still, a decent, for it being a free to play.,............

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
												Elsword Online. Not a terrible game. Not a good game. After a meager 2 years of playing this game myself (and a few hundred dollars), I can honestly say this game HAD a good conept at it's foundation. That element is still there, but you won't be able to enjoy due to a brutal pay-wall and tear-jerking balancing issues. This game should have stayed in beta for at LEAST another 2 years (from current date). if you're looking for a satisfying side-scrolling/arcade/RPG game, go play Super mario. What little character customization there is in this game is....well developed, and one of the most relevant pay-walls. Sadly, the "costumes" in this game aren't worth buying at all, as they pale in comparison to the fabeled ice Burner. If you're going to buy into this decent platformer, (I really can't call this an arcade-style game), don't watse your money on the costumes. Buy the B-Bar option, then buy hundreds of Ice Burners, and watch as your 1-in-200 odds steal your money away. IF, IF, you manage to get a full set for any one character, keep that character, and make all the other character-paths for that characters, as Ice Burner are the only shareable item your characters can swap between.My 1-to-5 rating?1 Phenomenal concept! Early-game must have been alot of fun! As it is now however, I can no longer respect or enjoy this pay-wall. (Not game, pay-wall).(This is an opinion. I STRONGLY recommend you read the other reviews on this game. The more you know, the better).

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												Alright, i finnaly have a max lvl character and ive spent enough time in this game to write a worthwhile review. Ill split my review in 2 parts; PVP and PVE, Aka. Players versus players and Player versus enemies (dongeons), which are the 2 parts of the experience this game as to offer.---------------------------------------Lets start with PVE.PVE consist of a set of dongeons, you go to the dongeon corresponding to your level, get some quests done, kill some bosses, nothing really ground breaking. The part that i hate about PVE in this game is that its REALLY REALLY easy, your party will just steam roll everything even on hard difficulty, later it gets more challanging but thats 100h into the game (if you make it that far) and even then its repetitive as hell anyway.TL;DR PVE is easy, grindy and boring---------------------------------------Now for PVP.PVP is quite simple, you go in 1v1 2v2 or 3v3 and try to kill the enemy, nothing fancy or complex going on here, you kill people, which is totally fine, not all games need 12 pvp modes. But it gets ugly rather quickly, heres a list of whats wrong with pvp:1: The ranked system is based of your total win rate and ignore your level totally so having a lvl 40 face a lvl 70 happens really often and of course the lvl 40 gets pummeled.2: PVP is pay2win, not by a lot, but still is, let me explain. You are limited to 4 skills at all times, however you can pay 10$ to unlock a second skillset and have 8 instead, effectively giving you twice the flexibility in combat. If you want to go far in PVP you better have dat 10 bucks.3: Random items, there are some random items that spawn in the pvp arena which grants various buffs and bonuses, theres no problem here so far. The problem arise that you cant turn them off in RANKED pvp. Adding a element of randomness to a RANKED match is just rage inducing to say the least.4: Lag, nothing much to say here, it lag and that sucks.5: Balance issues; Some classes are just flat out broken and little is done in order to balance them.TL:DR PVP is pay2win, laggy and unbalanced.

number of helpful: 10 of 18 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
Quick Overview: Fairly entertaining. The variety and art is nice and it has a sort of Smash Bros feel to it. I definitely don't recommend Elsword for someone who's expecting a lot. If you want a nice-looking anime RPG to play for a bit, though, I recommend it. (Of course, I've been playing this for a really long time, I'm not really speaking for myself)I started playing this game last year, before I found it on Steam, and I found myself playing it a LOT, for a few reasons.- I really loved the art, and I still do. The character design and art style is great. - The graphics are good. (They're pretty smooth.)- There's a lot of variety with the kind of class you want to choose. And even after you choose your class, there are (usually) three different branches/playstyles/"new job classes" you can take for your character, each one having their own attack range, difficulty to master, etc. If you get tired of one class, you can always make another. (with a max of 9 different character slots)- The plot is fairly entertaining, as well as the gameplay. The NPCs are great and I really love all of them. -The community on an overall is pretty okay. Generally the PvE community is really great and really friendly. (It can be an ENTIRELY different story for PvP, though, because the PvP community can be really toxic sometimes) As much as I like it, though, there are quite a few cons to consider. - The play-to-win problem is pretty bad. KOG sets it up so that it takes hours of heavy grinding and keyboard smashing if you don't want to pay money/k-ching. Costumes are your best bet for stat increases, and your default one expires after 15 days. After that, you have to pay. A lot of the features are also money-locked. Skill Slot B? Unless you stick around for the Grand Chase Event, you have to pay. The really nice skills? You can either complete killer quests that are designed to make you pull your hair out and give up, or you have to pay. - As I said earlier, the plot is pretty entertaining at first. After a while, the quests get pretty old and it's pretty much just completing dungeon after dungeon for PvE, until you run out of dungeons. (There aren't that many, especially if you're going for a long-term game) - Pay-to-win is pretty relevant in PvP. I personally don't have a ton of experience with PvP. But, from my experience, if you don't want to spend money on costumes to up your stats, forget getting up to an SSS rank. (I don't play much PvP for that reason.)-The PvP community can be toxic. People are constantly complaining about how bad you are if you mess up, or if your'e lagging. It's pretty bad sometimes. You learn to deal with it (It doesn't stop me), but for some people it can be enough to ruin the game.Final Words: Despite the flaws, I do still enjoy playing this game a fair amount. I find myself going back to it a lot, each time playing a different character. It's enjoyable, but I can't really recommend it to other people because of the cons.

												+Overall-This game is awesome Its a fighting game an a MMO all in one. I personally love playing RF because you punch everything but it has a variety of play styles for everbody for example Deadly Chaser a job class for chung is the Guile of Elsword an Elsword is kinda the Ryu. Not only does it contibute to the fighting Genre of fans but also anime fans because it has that feel but not too much to make both sides even.+Classes-So basically how it goes is you pick a character instead of a class (like a fighting game) an you proceed to level up the character and once you reach lvl 15 you get your first job change an after you reach 35 I believe you get your 2nd job change which is going to be your character from then on. each character will end up having 3 job classes and each one will be extremely different from the others, I'll use Raven as an example.-Reckless Fist is basically a character where he can take hits but aslo dish out damage aswell an uses his nasod arm instead of his sword doing high magical damage with super armor most of the time.-Blade Master focues around using his blade with very fast attacks before his opponent can but is very vulnerable to magical and a little bit to physical but he avoids this by being very mobile.-Veteran Commander is a cross between ranged and close combat basically a shoto character in a fighting game he isnt very tanky but he has good combos, good mobility and has high damaging specials making him a really dangerous class.Overall the class system is really good because there is something for everyone, If you like a powerhouse but like to be a little tanky go for Raven, if you like zoneing your oppoenent go Rena or Aisha, You wanna be in the opponents face almost all the time being very mobile and have good reach Ara, You just wanna go on full dmg not caring about defense Add is a good character to do that awell. Overall there is so much variety right now in elsword everyone can find a character.+GamplayNow this is the thing every person in a fighting game cares about and also in MMOs the gameplay. -PVPright now Elsword has a balanced system after a certain amount of hits a persons KDR(Knock Down Rate) will go up an make them fall ending the combo, but people can work around this and do something called a KD reset where they hit the oppoent in the air most of the time and bring them back down before they fall to the ground allowing them to continue the combo. Now before you think the first hit decides the match, MP (Mana Points) is a resource which everyone has and once you reach a hundred you can hold Light or Heavy attack and Mana Break forcing youself to fall ending the combo but like any other fighting game being on the ground is a big dis-advantage so stay mobile is key in elsword there is no true block button aside from one of Elsword's actives(I mean the character not the game, confusing yes I know). But like most fighting games it comes down to skill who can utilize his kit better then the other player, but like all other PVP games there is something OP once in awhile right now Ara and Elesis are very strong character being very mobile an sometimes having super armor and MAJOR damage moves one example to prove this is that in all big heard tournaments in Elsword usally Ara's always win because one of her jobs is insanley powerful. With the recently added character Add he is probably the most damaging character once he gets his conditions set but he has 0 to none defense being half healthed usally in one combo. But everything is usally patched or buffs are given to other character to balance it out, Elsword does a pretty good job about this so dont judge the game by a few characters.-PVEThis is something Elsword is minorly known for but before you go saying, "I side scroller? Thats probably so easy!". You are wrong because in dungens later in the game become really challenging making you follow mechanics so you cant have an easy time. It also has insane raid bosses that have tricky patterns to memorize making it a real challenge, also seasonal raid bossess so you get something new most of the time. I will say that some dungens can be done pretty easy if you got or bought a "Mount" basically these things only use is for dungens doing insane damage for a set amount of time but it doesnt entirley break the game one because they are expensive and they only have 100 stamina an may only last around 5-6 minutes at a time. Overall Elsword PVP isnt boring because it most of the time comes up with something knew almost every month or so actually quicker then that sometimes, it is in no way easy or boring.+GraphicsThey have simple graphics that look good, its not next gen realistic graphics its just simple but they somehow make it seem really appealing with their character designs and NPC design aswell, then the monsters arent those stupid over anime monsters that you see in other anime MMO RPGs, they actually make wood golems that wear a mask looking like they are hiding a scary face or something, overall this is short  and sweet to the point its nothing special but it isnt bad in the slightest way. If you want a comparison go look at Grand Chase compared to this game.+FinalI am probably skipping some points but this has been written long enough the overall game is good its fair to people who just want to play the game and not spend money in some aspects its a little bit like "Pay-to-Win" but overall no people buy accesorys to make there character look cool and the buffs they get from them aren't that big so it doesnt make a huge difference, if you dont want to spend money thats fine Elsword gives pleny of oppurtinitys to get accesorys for your character absolutely free for just playing the game. It is in no way a pay to win game. Gameplay is solid most of the time aside from some character being a little OP an some character having unfair moves but I say again it comes down to raw skill...most of the time! PVE is not boring an doesnt lack excitment with over the top bosses like a giant mecha robot with wings that fire giant lasers at you an can back hand you and instant kill you. Graphics are nice and simple also are really well used, this game is awesome at keeping to a fighting game Genre and MMO aswell I recomend that you try it atleast once if your a fighting game fan, get to the 2nd job class get to around 50 and start pvping after you get your gear (which is really easy to get) an start playing, watch some videos of people comboing learn an I gurantee you will have fun.I forgot to mention so many things in this review but this is basically the meat of it all so if you think this sounds awesome to you go join the community because its growing very slowly each day,

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Ah Elsword, I gotta say, this is one of the best Anime MMORPGs I've played in my experience as a gamer.Don't throw your F grenades yet, (and by F i mean F@%*) I do know about LOL, Diablo, WOW, and destiny, so hear me out and take your fingers out of the pin hole. Now I don't know about you guys, but when I'm about to jump into a new MMO, I tend to do research.I start with the little things, is it visually appealing? Does it have PVP and if it does is it well ballanced? Can I see my character fully instead of just the top of it's head? and most important, is it fun? In my opinion Elsword has everything an MMO should, awesome fast paced gameplay, unique character styles and combat, beautiful scenery, and blood pumping PvP action. And this for free!Dispite the gender locked characters that all start out the same, you are somehow able to still feel unique and different from any other player. Be it cosmetically or combat wise. You don't ahve to spend DAYS!!! trying to level up just to get past a stage. And admittedly, the dungeons can and will get kinda repetitive, this happenes in all gaming, the only way to avoid it is to keep coming out with new missions and updates. Which, as far as I know, Elsword does. Remember what I said about balanced PvP? Well this isn't exactly the best example. While it may seem impossible for a level 4 to absolutely destroy a level 70, I gotta say in Elsword, this isn't all that uncommon. What I like about ES's PvP is that it gives all players a chance, if they are skilled. What I don't like is that the new characters are automatically stronger and more efficient, which, outside of context makes perfect sence right? New meaning improved and more efficient. But honestly, its like you don't even need skill anymore, I normally play as the star character Elsword himself, but I tried one day as a new character named Ara. at level 10 I effortlessly conquered a level 64. and don't get me wrong, this was an A class player, he had experience! but Ara is absolutely unstoppable and has seemingly endless combos, thats absurd to me. But like I said, if you are more skilled than the other you will win. All in All, Elsword is a great game to play if you have patience and are a wiz at combos. I'd always recomend it to anyone who calls themself a gamer.                                                                   Gameplay: 9/10Story: 7/10PvP: 8/10Visuals: 9.5/10Community: 9/10

Posted: September 7, 2014
												Awesome game overall.  Requires buying to look nice, but I don't see that as an issue.  Higher levels require a lot of grinding, but this is a Korean RPG; what did you expect (*cough* Maplestory *cough*)?  Gameplay is smooth and connection is not really a problem.  PVP is tough, but I personally don't PVP too often, so it doesn't realy concern me.  Harder dungeons require more people, and unless you choose not to, you have to wait until you get into a party to enter hard and very hard dungeons.  It's quite hard to get into parties, but when you get in, it's really nice.  Really well-developed game, highly suggest to people who like rpg's.  Really don't suggest this to people who are impatient or get really annoyed by costumes or pvp.  But yea, try this game out.

Casual is probably an inappropriate category for this game if you plan to do more than dungeoun-running but it's hella fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												An interesting MMO. Sure there are other side-scrolling multiplayer games, like Awesomenauts, but that focuses more on team versus matches. With Elsword you have quality visuals, done in an anime-esque cell shading style, character voices are done in Japanesse (text is in English). What's different here is that the vast majority of the time, you don't need your mouse. All combat is controlled from the keyboard, from movement to attacks and the mouse only seems to be used for menus. Also, this game uses a Stamina system; killing monsters in dungeons uses stamina, the more players running that dungeon, the less you use. Stamina refills daily (3am PST), but is unlimited on weekends, and honestly, you can get at least 3-4 hours of dungeon time in on your daily stamina, so it's not a huge deal.What can be a bit confusing are the costume pieces from the real-money store. While they're nice and they can make your character look decent, they all seem to be limited-time use items. I may be wrong about that, but when you look at them the price is listed twice, one for a 30-day use and one permanent for 2x the 30-day price. You can get by without them, as they only apply stat boost on top of whatever your getting from armor/weapons/ect.That aside, the game is highly addictive. However, for most quest you seem to have to repeat dungeons over at least 2-3 times, often at specific difficulty levels or higher, but said dungeons have 3 difficulty levels and you can always just join a random group to take on the highest levels or run solo if you're feeling up to it. Dungeons are also split up, with some not letting you progress till all enemies are dead. One gripe I found was in the Skill Notebook quest where I had to run two dungeons over and over again in order to kill one enemy type because I need to collect 20 items, which were rare drops (I'd get 2-3 per run, max with some runs giving none). But most times you're asked to collect 20+ of an item you get it from every avaliable enemy kill, so it's only a problem in specific quests where the item is listed as Rare.In-game currency is easy to come by. At only 6 hours in I'd already accumulated over 300k, and probably spent even more upgrading my equipment as well, since you can get a lot of use out of equipment via enchanting, enhancing and repairing before you need to get something new.I haven't delved too deeply into crafting, but item/weapon enhancement is done two different ways, each adding diffrent things, so the system there is robust enough to allow for customization to play prefferences.In all it's a solid game with solid mechanics, detailed characters, both NPC and your own. My only real gripe is that unless you pay K-Ching (the games real-world money) you're limited to only 3 item quick-slots and 4 skill quick-slots, you're inventory is also limited, with 8 slot upgrades costing 200 K-Ching. However, 1 K-Ching is ~$.01, so it's not that big a cost (This is based off the 500 K-Ching pack costing $5US). But be warned that such upgrades are bought on a per character basis, so it costs about $14 per character to get +16 inventory spaces and all 8 skill quick slots, but you can play just as well with the stock free setup.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2013
												Hands down, this game has the best fighting system of all mmos. One of the problems that i have with other fighter mmos is that the combat are too slow. In this game however, it's fast just like how a fighting game should be, fast and intense. The dungeon can get boring after a while but the pvp is where this game shines. It is where you put what you have learn to use against other people, but I don't recommend you start pvping till you're level 35.2015 Update: There are now some balancing issues. Some characters/classes are just outright overpowered the other classes(Crimson Avenger/Diabolic Esper). Thankfully there is a patch coming that will be nerfing them.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2013
												I love this game! Its style is totally what I am into a heck lot. Though it may not work for everyone's liking.In terms of gameplay it can be rather fun and different from other games you may play.Characters:In this game all play differently, each and every individual character and class has its distinct features and all tend to accelerate in different ways.The characters all have very diverse skills and playstyles, surely it will make you feel like you're playing a manga/comic.Aside from the main topic, if you play in-game many people may complain (that's an NA server for you), however, each character has it's proper work around to getting through each task (including PvP which most people get salty at lol). I do have my fair share of getting frustrated, though after all it might just mean you may have been outplayed. (But this is a F2P game LOL, so expect overgeared players too... [Totally worth getting mad for sometimes])Dungeons:I have to say the dungeons in Elsword are also rather diverse xD!The scenery of each place tends to have a different feel.Oh, and not to mention!... There is also a dungeon to run through all the bosses, IT IS NOT A CAKEWALK AT ALL.Arena:The arena (PVP) in this game is hilariously fun.1v1 being the most skillful played in. Doing 1v1 truly shows how skillful you are (Or how much you can spam x_x... that can be useful I guess?... Not entirely a good thing to see.)2v2 being the most competitive. While doing 2v2s brings on teamwork, making tactics important to play with.3v3 being the most fun and chaotic xD! The amount of spammage is hilarious and you may not even be able to know what is going on, it's great, yet annoying. If you're too serious then it may not be as fun as it seems.(This may stand for everything in-game though, but it's best to have fun in PvP than get frustrated.)

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												An interesting MMO. Sure there are other side-scrolling multiplayer games, like Awesomenauts, but that focuses more on team versus matches. With Elsword you have quality visuals, done in an anime-esque cell shading style, character voices are done in Japanesse (text is in English). What's different here is that the vast majority of the time, you don't need your mouse. All combat is controlled from the keyboard, from movement to attacks and the mouse only seems to be used for menus. Also, this game uses a Stamina system; killing monsters in dungeons uses stamina, the more players running that dungeon, the less you use. Stamina refills daily (3am PST), but is unlimited on weekends, and honestly, you can get at least 3-4 hours of dungeon time in on your daily stamina, so it's not a huge deal.What can be a bit confusing are the costume pieces from the real-money store. While they're nice and they can make your character look decent, they all seem to be limited-time use items. I may be wrong about that, but when you look at them the price is listed twice, one for a 30-day use and one permanent for 2x the 30-day price. You can get by without them, as they only apply stat boost on top of whatever your getting from armor/weapons/ect.That aside, the game is highly addictive. However, for most quest you seem to have to repeat dungeons over at least 2-3 times, often at specific difficulty levels or higher, but said dungeons have 3 difficulty levels and you can always just join a random group to take on the highest levels or run solo if you're feeling up to it. Dungeons are also split up, with some not letting you progress till all enemies are dead. One gripe I found was in the Skill Notebook quest where I had to run two dungeons over and over again in order to kill one enemy type because I need to collect 20 items, which were rare drops (I'd get 2-3 per run, max with some runs giving none). But most times you're asked to collect 20+ of an item you get it from every avaliable enemy kill, so it's only a problem in specific quests where the item is listed as Rare.In-game currency is easy to come by. At only 6 hours in I'd already accumulated over 300k, and probably spent even more upgrading my equipment as well, since you can get a lot of use out of equipment via enchanting, enhancing and repairing before you need to get something new.I haven't delved too deeply into crafting, but item/weapon enhancement is done two different ways, each adding diffrent things, so the system there is robust enough to allow for customization to play prefferences.In all it's a solid game with solid mechanics, detailed characters, both NPC and your own. My only real gripe is that unless you pay K-Ching (the games real-world money) you're limited to only 3 item quick-slots and 4 skill quick-slots, you're inventory is also limited, with 8 slot upgrades costing 200 K-Ching. However, 1 K-Ching is ~$.01, so it's not that big a cost (This is based off the 500 K-Ching pack costing $5US). But be warned that such upgrades are bought on a per character basis, so it costs about $14 per character to get +16 inventory spaces and all 8 skill quick slots, but you can play just as well with the stock free setup.

												Hands down, this game has the best fighting system of all mmos. One of the problems that i have with other fighter mmos is that the combat are too slow. In this game however, it's fast just like how a fighting game should be, fast and intense. The dungeon can get boring after a while but the pvp is where this game shines. It is where you put what you have learn to use against other people, but I don't recommend you start pvping till you're level 35.2015 Update: There are now some balancing issues. Some characters/classes are just outright overpowered the other classes(Crimson Avenger/Diabolic Esper). Thankfully there is a patch coming that will be nerfing them.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2013
												I love this game! Its style is totally what I am into a heck lot. Though it may not work for everyone's liking.In terms of gameplay it can be rather fun and different from other games you may play.Characters:In this game all play differently, each and every individual character and class has its distinct features and all tend to accelerate in different ways.The characters all have very diverse skills and playstyles, surely it will make you feel like you're playing a manga/comic.Aside from the main topic, if you play in-game many people may complain (that's an NA server for you), however, each character has it's proper work around to getting through each task (including PvP which most people get salty at lol). I do have my fair share of getting frustrated, though after all it might just mean you may have been outplayed. (But this is a F2P game LOL, so expect overgeared players too... [Totally worth getting mad for sometimes])Dungeons:I have to say the dungeons in Elsword are also rather diverse xD!The scenery of each place tends to have a different feel.Oh, and not to mention!... There is also a dungeon to run through all the bosses, IT IS NOT A CAKEWALK AT ALL.Arena:The arena (PVP) in this game is hilariously fun.1v1 being the most skillful played in. Doing 1v1 truly shows how skillful you are (Or how much you can spam x_x... that can be useful I guess?... Not entirely a good thing to see.)2v2 being the most competitive. While doing 2v2s brings on teamwork, making tactics important to play with.3v3 being the most fun and chaotic xD! The amount of spammage is hilarious and you may not even be able to know what is going on, it's great, yet annoying. If you're too serious then it may not be as fun as it seems.(This may stand for everything in-game though, but it's best to have fun in PvP than get frustrated.)

												Elsword is an awesome game.But why i do not recomend this game?Elsword is broken, it is a fact.And the Developer (KOG games) just seems to be obssesed with pleasing themself (and their wallet), lets break it down then.Every new character, the developer has stated that they intentionally overpower this new character, making it a biased game everytime a character is released, then nerf it a little and continue with the cycle.Nerfs are nice now and again, but they do not listen a single suggestion the community has given, reason why overpowered characters remain overpowered even after nerf.Equipment, any game that rely on equipment on PvP is bound to be pay to win, people may say it is not, but tell them if  a +10 weapon will not win a +7 weapon? This game is infested with it and it means so much while in PvP, does not matter how fast or good you are, you lag or the enemy lag, it turns the table way to significantly, this will not be fixed because of how the game is developed (Peer to peer)For an old game it is odd how high the prices are in the cash shop.Elsword is pretty much the Perfect World of action/2D genre, that pretty much sums it up.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I have played and enjoyed my fair share of hours in this game, that being said the microcharge for everything they can.You can buy a lot of advantages so it can be quite unbalanced for the true Free-to-play player.Examples:Magic Necklace - Improves your mana aquisation by +30% when attacking or being attacked. 800KC/8$Full Costume Packages - Can be socketed for additional stats 2390KC/23.9$B-slot - Allows you to use 4 more skills in PvE and PvP - 900KC/9$Item mall rings - Adds additional skill points to some of your skills (depending on what ring you choose) 700KC/7$Items can be gifted so you CAN aquire theese items by buying them from players who sell their KC, but the economy of this game is so broken and the prices are absolutely ridicoulus. Futhermore, it still requires someone to actually pay for and support this kind of business.What makes this game worth playing is that it is the only one of it's kind out there for anime-style slice-em up fast paced PvE and PvP, had there been any other game similar to this, with better balance of prices and general management of the game I would have choosen that any day.GAMEPLAY: Gameplay is very stale and repetative, people say that "it is what you can expect from an Korean MMO" but it doesen't change the fact that it's a grind-fest. In order to level you are required to spam the same dungeons over and over again, and when you run out of story quests for your level, you get to farm fields until you level up, only do open your new story quests and spam the same dungeon over and over. Some bosses in the game are fun mechanicaly but most of them are hardly worth the mention. PvE is super easy, with the exception of some of the end game Secret Dungeons, which sometimes just feels like are made hard on few areas to make you buy resurrection stones.Overall, unless you want to burn your money, grind forever, I would find another game. However, as said before, there hardly exist anything like this out there yet. Which is too bad. This game has a lot of great potential but it is wasted on KoG/KillerCombo trying to suck every penny out of you. While playing, you are often left with a feeling of being a mindless consumer, which is not a good feeling for any game to leave you with.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
												The Only MMO I have placed more than a total of One Hundred hours on even before I played it on steam. Controls are fun and simple enough to understand, graphics are pretty good at presenting the atmosphere of a field or dungeon. Music is phenomenal, and one of my favorite game soundtracks period. My only gripes are with the lack of customability for the characters on an Asthetic level without having to pay about five dollars for a wig. I wish you could at least change the hair color or eye style. My second gripe is with the PVP. It is INCREDIBLY unbalanced. Often times, I found myself as a fresh character of level ten or even five going up against a level 80 player. It's like sending a kid with a stick and a pot on his head out into a battle against Beowulf or Hercules. But overall, I believe this game to be a fantastic Multiplayer experience with friends, and I am looking forward to the upcoming Elsword anime. But hey, who am I to judge? Try it out and judge it for yourself.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
												I must say, I've played this game for quite some time and it's stuck with me. If you love manga/anime and you're looking for a great online RPG to get addicted to and emersed in, this is the game for you. A one-of-a-kind hack and slash fast-paced side scroller.Pros:- Excellent customisablity of gameplay- EXCELLENT COSMETICS (reason enough for an anime/manga fan to play)- Fun and enjoyable graphics/themes- Highly addictive playstyle- Flexible combosCons:- Hard exp table->> You're going to really feel the grind with this one- Cashing has huge advantages (+50% exp medals, BSlots, Mana necklaces to name a few)- Hugely inflated player economy->> It's going to be hard to get anything near luxury-tier if you start out and don't plan to cash- Server locks (You're usually not able to play cross-continent, which isn't great if you have overseas friends)- Genderlocked classes (if you want to shoot arrows, magic or play with drones you have to be female, if you want to wield a sword or cannon you have to be male...)- Stamina system (restricts how much you can play per day)Overall, I'm well aware that this game has it's downfalls, but again if you're an anime or manga fan with a love for online RPGs, then I wouldn't hesitate to reccommend this.Feel free to chat to me in game if you feel like it. ;DIGN: Primacy

												Don't get me wrong this game is fun to play and the style of the characters, levels, enemies and weapons are interesting however.Due to certain reasons i'm unable to actually launch the game since the game forced me into having it into windows however that can be due to my own end.Also to my own opinion theres to much information and text going on around the screeen for you to enjoy and due to that reason the text it self is also kind of small so for people with damaged eyesight like me will have trouble same with people who have problems when it comes to keeping up with things that popping up within a few seconds, also people with epilepsy (sorry if i spelled it wrong i'm very dumb) should not play due to that certain attacks have bright flashes and such.Plus if you want to play with friends in different countries/regions then you cant becuase of the fact that the severs you play on are based on where you region is so that option is directly ou the region and to be honset I am not sure if there is but personaly I belive that there should be a hide other layers option because there are a lot of players so it can get confusing at times.In the end I say if you are sure your computer/laptop/mac can support it and you dont mind confusing text and random stuff then your should try this game however if your more for the simplistic and fun type of games then you should think about downloading this game and probably not download it and try to find another game.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
												Pretty Straight forward. Move to either the left or the right (depending on where the game wants you to go) and kill everything in your way. With 8 characters each with multiple job changes for each to keep combat exciting with more skills added to the skill tree. As the game progresses the dungeons get harder, monsters get stronger and the importance of a team is almost required by level 40+. As a person that has used all of the classes, I can firmly say that each has it's advantages and drawbacks, some more than others of course, but that does with any game. This is not your typical MMO with healer, tank, and DPS. Each character is equally capable of dishing out death and destruction across the 2-d dungeons.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												Elsword is my all-time favorite PC game and I've been playing it for a little over 3 years now. Some people give it a bad reccomendation because of it's claim to be a "Free to play game" and say that it's a "Pay to win". I will admit that I have put quite a bit of money into Elsword, but that's simply because I love the game and have an addiction to the PVP side of it. However, if you play mostly for dungegon and aren't a PVP type of person, you can surely get by perfectly fine without paying a dime. Putting money into it is all up to you and your preference; I mean, really good equipment sets can be obtained through doing secret dungeons too, and that's always free, just a lot of work. Elsword is not ALL "Play to win". I would totally recommend trying the game out.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												     This fast-paced fighting game is a 2-d phenomenon, making what you see in animes possible.  There are many classes to choose from to better suit your fighting style.  One of the stand-out things in this game is the creativity of the abilities.  Most games will have a spin attack and some buff moves for a sword class, but instead you get a variety of flying blades, explosions, and other amazing attacks.  The artstyle is fresh and the music never gets old.  Cosmetics are quite different compared to most games, and are worth the money if one would want to spend it.  Oh yeah, and by the way,  this game is not pay to win.  Paying mostly only gets you cosmetics which don't affect stats.  The combat system may just look like a skilless beat em' up game from outside, but when you get into it you realise it goes deep with mechanics and techs.  Overall, this is a masterpiece of a fighting game that should have a long life to entertain for years to come.  It just never gets old!
