number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												Wost MMO i've played in a LONG time. FREEMIUM and PAY-TO-WIN at its finest. Most free MMOs have paid "cash" items that give cosmetic changes and are made to look cool, but this games cash items actually give stat bonuses, if they work in PvP or not I don't care its still BULL. This game is so bugged out its not even funny: its a combo based game and the enemies will LITERALLY TELEPORT BEHIND YOU breaking your combo, when an enemy teleports behind you another enemy will come up behind you and trap you and combo you to death, the enemies are solid objects so you can't walk by them and you will be knocked down back in between them if you try to jump out from between them which on most maps is a must if you can't stagger or knock back the enemies which enemies won't be, the quest system is buggy and event quests DON'T work properly, the options don't work properly. Now done with the bugs my problems with the game: defaults to windowed mode and the full screen option doesn't work unless it is restarted (which granted is usual for SOME games), its a combo based game, moving from map to map takes forever and is slow, the map is 2D and 3D moving between this is a pain in the rear, its pay-to-win, you can only equip 4 skills if you want more you have to PAY for it, item inventory is tiny to expand it you PAY for it, for the size of the inventory to many items drop basically forcing you to either sell your entire inventory or PAY to have it expanded, the tutorial sucks and doesn't tell anything about the game, the key binds are not obvious and make no sense, the game does an absolute horrible job at showing how much health you have, *the potions are useless and heal nothing its easier to die and respawn right where you died with no penalty or reprocussion because you come back with full health and mana, the UI is not user or beginner friendly at all and the tutorial doesn't help you basically need to come out of the womb knowing how to play this game or look up how to play if you're a beginner, there is a constant tutorial that flashes over your skill set and gets annoying after playing for 4 hours telling me to hit left CTL for a skill that does really nothing, my first time playing it froze the minute I got to the starting town cause my friend sent me a party and friend invite then it froze again randomly in the middle of playing but this time it came back. I love MMORPGs but this is the WORST I have played, absolute garbage and horse dung. probably will NEVER PLAY AGAIN. Only reason why I played is because me and my friend made a deal to play each others MMOs with each other for a week. In short: God this was utter trash and a NIGHTMARE to play I never want to play again nor probably never will.*I was playing Add which is supposidly a "mage class" apparently this mage has more health than normal mages in otther MMOs because i used a potion that healed 4500hp and barely healed a 5th of my hp and this game DOESN'T show your max HP so its hard to tell how much you have so you just need to guess how much HP you have, and the potions are on a 60 second cool down. 60 SECONDS even if you have 3 DIFFERENT potions on your quick slots they ALL go on cooldown, if the potions REGENED health it would be a different story or if there is no cooldown for the others it would be fine.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
												To start off, let's do a quick summary of what Elsword is:Elsword is a Anime Styled, Side Scrolling, Free to Play, Class-based RPG Fighter in which you are given the choice of 9 different characters to fight with, level up and "evolve" so to say. Each character has different skill trees which can be chosen to fit your personal gameplay style. Like to play as a Free Knight and acquire pyromancer abilities? Choose Elesis! Like being a Tank for your team? Choose Chung! How about being an Archer to attack from long range? Choose Rena! This selection of characters is great for all kinds of players and helps broaden the audience for this game. It has typical elements which you can expect from an RPG: Armour, Special weapons, potions, grinding etc. These elements fit well into the world of Elsword, helping you defeat bosses in dungeons to earn XP and gain better armour and weapons!Speaking of bosses, there may be repetition with such bosses as Banthus but besides that, they are both challenging and rewarding. The game itself seems to get very addicting when you are trying to level up your character and get them to their next form or "evolution" as I've said before. The stamina bar is used to prevent addiction. This bar is gradually used up as you complete dungeons and once you are out of stamina you cannot do any more dungeons for the day. Stamina is refilled every day though as well as having unlimited stamina at weekends so all you fanatics can play to your hearts content.In closing, I believe Elsword is a fun, vibrant and addicting game and I recommend it to all of you anime or RPG lovers.

Play Castle Crashers instead for example or wait until DFOG beta begins.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2016
												A very fun game, i prefer to use the game launcher from the website but you can go either way.This game has pros and cons but is very enjoyable if you dont mind doing the same dungeon 3-4 times over and over again as it does indeed get old But lets get on to the pros and cons.Pros:-Very enjoyable for something in your off time.-PvE is enjoyable. -A nice leveling scale as it gets pretty difficult for 60-85 (I found it quite difficult)-Nice idea of job changes for each character which supplies a character with new combos and skills making it a very refreshing game if you like to do the main story over again just to try out each characters job change (each job change has a 2nd version which makes it gain more skills and combos).-Manages to pull off a good anime style type of game.-Side scrolling beat em up MMoRPG thats enjoyable.Cons:-PvP is Unbalanced (Basically PTW).-Repetitive.-New classes tend to be more powerfull then the old ones.-Can get insanely boring later on in the higher levels trying to get to 85.And thats pretty much it, there isnt really anything else about this game other than its enjoyable for awhile but gets boring near the middle of the game and the pvp is pretty unbalanced most of the times, but its a must play if you enjoy playing through dungeons over and over again or like making people salty in pvp (Beause NA is salty AF).

Posted: December 30, 2013
												While it offer a unique indie experience the many recent changes make the game more and more grindy for users, with recent changes toward implement more chance element toward the old item crafting it become rediculously hard to get some of the better gears in the game. This have negatively impacted the gaming experience, leaving people unhappy after spending tens of hours in limited time event dungeon only to be let down every time they open the box. As the result I cannot recommend the game to anyone who is goal oriented since you wil find after spending hundred of hours in the game you are often not rewarded for your effort without spending lot of real money.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												At first i love Elsword, it was a cute side scroller and the dungeons were actually pretty fun... then i got into the pvp or arena as they call it and i absolutely hated it. Elswords Arena is the most broken pvp in a online rpg i have ever experienced. The new character ADD can hit you once then constantly stun lock you until your hp drops or they fail the combo which is highly unlikely as it is just  a mashing of zzzz or xxxx constantly. Add is not the only op character that they have. Aisha's Elemental Master Job can literally just teleport all over the map gaining mp constantly to spam her most powerful skills where your stuck there chasing her the entire game. Eve's Battle Seraph job is just one big spam fest. Basically this games pvp lacks fairness and is generally just made up of spamming, running, and over powered characters compared to the others. I would not recommend this game as the dungeons while they may be fun get boring super quick then your left with a lack luster arena filled with overpowered characters.

												This game is fun for about 4 or 5 days, until you realize that you're just going to be doing the same thing over and over, and that none of the characters play like how you want to. Do you want to play as the robot girl? How about the Sora reject? It's just loaded with clique anime characters, lots of grinding, and it's totally held back by the cash shop. I seriously wanted to look past the cash shop and stupid boring anime characters, and have fun with the game, but found that impossible after a week. Like I said, this♥♥♥♥♥♥is fun for a few days, and gets old fast. There's better grinders, better dungeon crawlers, better everything out there. This game is just great at fooling you into thinking it's bad♥♥♥♥♥ early in the game.I would reccomend this to people with short term memory loss.

												The game is rather fun and the community can be tough love at points, but there is fun times to be had in the game and well. I'm not the type to tell you lies and lies would it be to say the dungeons are the main point of the game, nah they simply give you something to do until your a high enough lvl to fight in PvP or raids. Asides that character and class choices are a plenty so hell have fun picking your character(s) and well dressing them up and stuff, sure you gotta pay money for it but hey if you've gotten past lvl 45 then I can say you already enjoy the game enough to spend some cash on a few things m'kay? at anyrate if your going for dungeons expect to see some bored people who either way that item or want to finish this quest, I suggest for the greener horns ya follow the quest line until ya figure out what to do with your iron buns ya got from sitting there for so long, then question going into PvP and then find out the hard way 300 MP moves all across the board isn't the way to go, And raids will kick your♥♥♥♥♥so hard you'll be married to em. All and all once you learn what to do which isn't hard mind you, the game becomes quite addictive and fun. I mean...what can you lose? pick it up and play it and see if I'm wrong, I'm merely just putting up my due thoughts on this game.

												What I like.+Simple movelist and combos.+Game load times.+Characters.+PvP game modes ok.+Customize characters.+Grinding not so bad.+PvP without lag. Without lag this game is awesome.


YouTube™ Video: Lagless Elsword 2vs2 Rank Match 

			Views: 25		

			Lagsword best way describe pvp community, but get rare unicorns have great connections. Like I was fighting my friends right next to me. Sad because I'm always thinking fighting people from Mars..		

What I hate.-Character balance is problem. Characters like Add have teleport, long range hitbox melee attacks, projectiles, homing projectiles and high damage plus a lot more crap I can't think of. What more character need get job done? Looking at SNK boss here.-3vs3 mode use be fun mode until added Hyper skills to mix. Street Fighter and Tekken did it right, Elsword on other hand f it up with Hyper spam wars.-Terrible content updates. -Events straight up joke compare to Korean version.-Pay to win.-In game money is useless.-People abusing rank system. People deranking or using low rank players get matchs.-Lag serious problem. Freaking serious problem!

												I may not have as many hourse as some other reviewers here, but I did play the game quite a lot when it first came to Steam and then some a few months down the line in short bursts. I will say that like the others here, I have noticed the game gradually try to add in more and more ways of taking your money. PvP gradually became less and less balanced, and PvE was a grindfest of repeating dungeons over and over with little reward. If you\'re new and wanting to try it out, sure. It\'s still a fun game. But don\'t expect to stick around for the long haul, where real progress actually matters.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												I just hit level 70. I'm pretty friendly if you ever see me ingame. If you ever see someone using a megaphone saying "EVERYBODY SUCKS BUT ME!!" chances are that's probably me. I'm not being serious though. Grats to anyone who actually gets the simpsons reference whenever I do that. About the game though...when people say this game is very pay to win, they are not joking. I've put 132 hours into this game. It took me 2 very long months to hit level 70. Towards the end I started using plus 50% exp boosts. Aside from that, I spent over 100 dollars on multiple things from more inventory space to unlocking my hot bar to accessories and what not. If you're looking for something that's completely free to play you might want to avoid this one. Personally I can't put the game down just because it has a lot of my favorite genres all wrapped up into one nice package. I also love how the main focus of it is a side scrolling online beat em up pretty much. If you're really into that sort of thing, you'll ♥♥♥♥ing love the game like I did and probably want to go all the way to 70, maybe even spend a little bit of money here and there. I will say I thoroughly enjoyed every moment from level 1 to 70. Best of luck to everyone whatever game they decide to play. This is born, signing out.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2016
												first off i have spent alot of time in this game i would would not recommend it to someone who has a low income rate or isn't prepared to spend moneythe game can be fun and has a bit of life in it each new town is awesome to go to when you unlock it and the dungeons that come with it are really cool looking but have to do them atleast 3 times to move on to the next one in the story line is really annoying(it moves up to 5-8 times in the high levels)the leveling in the game is really hard to do without getting an exp boost item(its even hard with that but alittle easier) i have a charcter in the 80(cap is 85 at time of writting) and doing one dungeon gives about 8-9% of the exp bar and dungeons are your main sorce of levelingstay out of the item mall if you do play. i repeat STAY OUT OF THE ITEM MALL. it is not needed to go into it but getting something from it costs alot of money. there are costumes in this game and you'd expect them to have nop stats and just change how you look KOG said "♥♥♥♥ that you buy a costume it makes your stats better than a f2p". the costumes cost around 25-31 dollars to get the whole set which also have set bonuses to increase your stats even more.pvp is not worth doing. all pvp comes down to is stun locking(its a system whereif you get hit you are stunned for a second and if you keep hitting they stay stunned there is a way to get out of it but it's crap).it boils down to who can hit first and thats it which makes so slow attacking charcters useless. if anyone losses in pvp they just complain about something you did or that a 												I may not have as many hourse as some other reviewers here, but I did play the game quite a lot when it first came to Steam and then some a few months down the line in short bursts. I will say that like the others here, I have noticed the game gradually try to add in more and more ways of taking your money. PvP gradually became less and less balanced, and PvE was a grindfest of repeating dungeons over and over with little reward. If you\'re new and wanting to try it out, sure. It\'s still a fun game. But don\'t expect to stick around for the long haul, where real progress actually matters.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												I just hit level 70. I'm pretty friendly if you ever see me ingame. If you ever see someone using a megaphone saying "EVERYBODY SUCKS BUT ME!!" chances are that's probably me. I'm not being serious though. Grats to anyone who actually gets the simpsons reference whenever I do that. About the game though...when people say this game is very pay to win, they are not joking. I've put 132 hours into this game. It took me 2 very long months to hit level 70. Towards the end I started using plus 50% exp boosts. Aside from that, I spent over 100 dollars on multiple things from more inventory space to unlocking my hot bar to accessories and what not. If you're looking for something that's completely free to play you might want to avoid this one. Personally I can't put the game down just because it has a lot of my favorite genres all wrapped up into one nice package. I also love how the main focus of it is a side scrolling online beat em up pretty much. If you're really into that sort of thing, you'll ♥♥♥♥ing love the game like I did and probably want to go all the way to 70, maybe even spend a little bit of money here and there. I will say I thoroughly enjoyed every moment from level 1 to 70. Best of luck to everyone whatever game they decide to play. This is born, signing out.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												    XD here with a brief review of the game Elsword and strongly recomend this game to anyone who likes adventuring socializing, talking and trading items. Also, who don't mind spending a few dollars on customising and upgrading the character or characters they plan on using later on in the game. This game is a side strolling 3D beat em up japanese anime game with real-time fighting doing combo combinations while using spells and magic moves and skills in your repithior to defeat your enermies. You can also use skill points to unlock new skills and new moves as you progess through the game and get stronger meaning that you and somebody else could have the same character but could fight in totaly different ways and set different  skill moves to manipulate his/her character the way they see fit. Each character has his/her storyline of why they are here and their porpose of fighting which you would find out more of if you decide to try this game which i personally think you won't put down when get heads and tails of things :). I just a few months ago tried the game myself and today still play it because there are so many things in the game that you can do and new things and great deals and oppertunities get added to the game on a regular basis. Plus you can hang out in this game with your friends form parties and/or groups together talk, trade, socialize in real-time go in dungeons together or solo talk and stratigize while fighting with your friends in real-time. Or if you got to go or stop playing for a while for what ever reason can withdraw from the group/party at anytime with the push of a button on your character's personal social option. Plus they start you off with ten resurrection stones and a long bar of life when you first start off and a combo list for your character that you can improve on as you level up and progress though the game. At the beginning of the game you can choose the character you want to figh as and that character's storyline will begin after you put your personal user name in to identify yourself in the game. If it turns out that you don't like that character you could make up to four characters or four of the same characters in anyway you see fit. From the clothes they wear to the way they fight, you controll it all. Or you could chose the character you don't want any more and press delete the game would then ask you: "Are you sure you want to delete the character?" Click yes and the character will be deleted no and the character will be spared. In my opinion, this game is one of the best  games i have ever played and am in it for the long-hall/run they people in this game will get tired of seeing me and say "oh there gos XD again." Also, after customising your character putting your moves together and learn your skills you can challege your friends and other people online in tournaments that gives you prises, sparring sessions and practice sessions for fun and to develope your realtime fighting skills that you can level up by appling SP/SkillPoints that you get when you level up from beating dungeons. There are different areas to too each with different materials you need to craft new weapons, amor and clothes, you will find out more about this in the game. Anyways, that's some of the basic things you can do in this game if interested you should give i a try and might end up liking the game more than me. :)                                                                                                                       From XD Big fan of Elsword

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
												I have more hours in this game on the non steam version, so I think my opinion holds some weight.Im was actually very undecided about whether I want to reccomend this game or not. Its not for everyone. Alot of the things said in the positive and negative reviews are true. Many are false. But the one thing that bothers most is the p2w aspect. Its true that there are alot of things in the game that you have to pay for. It is true that alot of these things can be earned overtime (I have obtained a couple costumes, a pet, and even the extra slot w/o paying real money). It really depends on how willing you are to work for it. You can obtain the second slot from the board, but it will cost a helluvalot of ED (around 85-120mil ED depending on current prices players are selling it for). The same can be said for alot of items you can buy with real money. Some items can be obtained temporarily and permanently through events (Good gear, costumes, pets,extra slots,etc). You can get access to things you normally would have to pay for temorarily, or get a chance to attempt to obtain money items permanently.The actual gameplay is pretty fun. Some reviews say that its repetitive. Its really up to you on this one. There are only two buttons used for basic attacks in this game.They arent light/heavy attacks, but just two different ways of attacking.(For example, if you play as Raven, pressing z will use you blade and x the nasod arm). Different combinations of presses will result in different combos(Ex: pressing xxzzz with Raven will make you  do two simple nasod arm hits and then unleash a flurry of slashes with one final slash). What combos are available to you vary between characters. You will receive two more basic moves when you reach your next job change. Try to incorprate this with your skills (your options will widen as you level up). Once again, its really up to you on how fun that will be. PvP takes alot of skill, knowing just a bit about the opponent's class, and some good gear (at least ok gear at low levels) You will run into some OP players and players who  will be of a higher level than you are by variable margins. You dont have to worry in PvE. The rank you get at the end of a dungeon will not effect how much xp you obtain and neither will the amount of players with you.Thats all I really have to say about the game regarding other reviews. Personally, I do like the game and have been playing for a while. All in all just give it a try and see if you like it.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												Elsword is really fun.Why?It has fast-paced gameplay, a plethora of characters- each having an unique class change with different specialties, a fun PvP system.The gameplay is fun. One might assume it's a standard button-masher, yet it is so much more. Variety of combos each requiring good timing for maximum punishment. The Characters- Each have their own fighting style. One could find any style to fit his or her gameplay, whether one enjoys shooting big cannons, stabbing enemies, shooting fireballs or arrows. PvP is exciting a chance to climb the ranks. Each having their own AP tier. Although it does have some lag and balancing issues. Overall it is a fun game and a must-play. Additionally since the NA elsword is behind the KR elsword the game is always being updated. This allows new content to arrive very quickly.If you are looking for a fun anime-like game, you should play this already!

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Elsword is a classic beat-em-up with suprisingly interesting strategy involved. Once past the beginning parts of the game, you might find yourself dodging boss attacks and trying to maintain your large combos in order to get high rankings in the dungeon. With its simple, yet potentially complex mechanics, comic book-style graphics, and totemo kawaii-desu characters, Elsword is a blast for casual and hardcore gamers alike.

Posted: September 1, 2014
												well, this game is awesome, it is very fun, it has a good variety of classes, you can job change, it has a lot of weapons and armor sets, it has some nice looking costumes, you have special moves (Actives, special actives, and a hyper active for second job change), you can level up your character to get more passives, actives etc, it has a good selection of dungeons EACH village, the dungeons have monsters minibosses and bosses, the minibosses and bosses have Unique drops, there are a lot of NPCs and quests that they can give you, there are about 7 villages, you can buy craft and sell things, honestly, this game is the best i've seen in years, and there's one thing i forgot to mention: THIS GAME HAS INFINITE LOOPS! it helps a lot with PVP, so the only way they can get out of an infinite loop is to mana break (Hold down X or Z until it comes to 100 mana), and, well, all in all, this game is AWESOME! 15/10! an absolute must play!

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												Elsword is really fun.Why?It has fast-paced gameplay, a plethora of characters- each having an unique class change with different specialties, a fun PvP system.The gameplay is fun. One might assume it's a standard button-masher, yet it is so much more. Variety of combos each requiring good timing for maximum punishment. The Characters- Each have their own fighting style. One could find any style to fit his or her gameplay, whether one enjoys shooting big cannons, stabbing enemies, shooting fireballs or arrows. PvP is exciting a chance to climb the ranks. Each having their own AP tier. Although it does have some lag and balancing issues. Overall it is a fun game and a must-play. Additionally since the NA elsword is behind the KR elsword the game is always being updated. This allows new content to arrive very quickly.If you are looking for a fun anime-like game, you should play this already!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												This game is extremely fun when you play with friends or a guild. However most people quit right away for specific reasons. One of the reasons is not liking the character/class you chose. In order to fully enjoy this game you have to find the character/characters that suits your playing style. Then decide if you want to PVP or PVE or both. At the higher levels of this game it could seem a little bit grindy since you have to repeat dungeons alot. As far as cash shop goes, it's really expensive however, through patience and participating in events you could honestly avoid spending too much money.There's only one thing you have to buy if you go that route. You have to buy a B slot so you can use your other skills. Elsword is quite enjoyable but you have to give it a real try before discrediting it.Negatives are:-Half the population doesn't speak english and half the ones who do are immature kids.-Costumes and mounts and decent gear are extremely expensive and game is cash shop drawn, expected though.-Grindier at the higher levels-Not newbie friendly, especially when it comes to terms with skill points and stuff. Since you have to figure out your playing style and what skills you prefer. Guides are nice but everyone has a preference.-Events can seem a bit lame and generic at times.Positives are:-Fast paced side scrolling action. It's not a point-and-click game. It's also not too heavily gear based as it is skill based.-Every boss is different and unique.-New content continously-When you do find those special friends, it's totally fun running dungeons, taking screenshots for events, goofing off in the town squares, and showing off your pets and costumes and mounts!-Getting in-game currency isn't hard at all. El shards are always profitable as well as boss drops and your ED from dungeon runs.-Pvp is pretty fun with friends, solo match making is for all the try hards who have something to prove online so I would avoid that because they are usually hardcore and rage alot.-My favorite reason for playing Elsword is my friends, so the best idea is to find good ones!As for typical ratings here they are!4/5 For gameplay4/5 For content [We usually always get new content but it takes a bit longer on NA server]2/5 For community [Good friends are a jewel and people always come and go]1/5 For affordability [Cash shop super over priced]5/5 For customization [Tons of different [cool, cute, and intimidating] pets and even rare ones from events. and characters are pretty unique considering they have 3 different classes which change their stance, pose, and voice not to mention costumes! Mounts were recently released so there aren't many yet!]2/5 For customer support3/5 For gamepad support [Better off using custom keys on gamepad]

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2015
												Typical RPG, good for procrastination.I read reviews and decided to play this essentially as a single player game. Lowered my expectations greatly and helped me avoid disappointment.Things that annoyed meInventory is absolutely miniscule, you'll fill it up in a few hours of play. Pay to inventory.Half of your 8 skill slots are locked. No game design sense at all.Half of your 6 items slots are locked. Not as bad because most potions have a 1 minute shared cooldown.Market system has little functionality; search by name and item type and thats about it. No price sorting, no quantity sorting, just terrible.Very little sense of community; to enter a dungeon, just click the button in the top right corner and you'll be put into a queue, no matter where you are. PvP arena is the same. Players rarely congregate in any one area due to this.Questline is boring and repetitive; consecutive quests in the same questline will direct you to the exact same dungeon over and over. Gender locked class system; everyone looks the same.Features that kept me mildly interested for a whilePlayer made combos; for those who like combos based off animation cancelling, this is a good way to spice up your gameplay, takes some practice though.Gender locked class system; easiest excuse to play a loli.Designated 'training room' to practice combos; you don't actually bother with comboing in dungeons though.NPCs saying Annyeong all the time.Try it out, I get bored grinding my face off, not for everyone I guess.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												My friend got me addicted to this game a while back and I really enjoyed it. There are lots of events and recent updates. PVP is pay to win but have real skill, max level, and decent gear you can win. I play games when I feel like and with all the constant changes I get overwhelmed and stoped playing. If you love anime and combo mmorpg's then this is for you.Pro's-Constant events and updates-Anime style graphics-High level max(currently lvl85)-Dungeons, Raids, and Fields/PVE-PVP seasons-Skills-Professions-Anime-Characters with first and second job change(aka class)-Pets-Items-Player market(list items for trade and buy items for sell by players)-You can get almost anything in game with standard currency(just need some connection)-AnimeCon's-Constant events and updates-Expensive premium currency/shop(about $40 for a costume on one character)-Pay to win pvp-Grinding for levels, gear, and items(one of the very few things I can't stand)-Hoplessly long questsReplay value: inf/10 ~ 2 addicting.Overall: 9/10 ~ Love this game too much. Hard to stop playing

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												I don't usually break my habit of lurking, so that should say something about this game. I've been playing this game for years now, having joined just after it got out of beta testing, way before it made it on steam. This game is, at its core, a game with brawling combos. If you don't like those, or sidescrolling, don't play this game. Otherwise, there's no reason not to give it a try. That being said, I've been witness to many "problems" people have with the game, so I'll go ahead and list them, as well as my reasons why people shouldn't be quite as put off by them as they are:1. Stamina - Stamina is infamous. When it's depleted, your character no longer has the ability to enter dungeons (disregarding the special boss rush dungeon Henir). I'm honestly not as put off by this one as many, as it allows you to focus on multiple characters without burning out one by playing that for days on end. In addition, weekends have unlimited stamina, so push your mains all you want on those days.2. The field system - this is only a issue with other players who miss the old system. I don't actually have many oppinions on this other than that the fields provide an incredible source of exp, which will prove handy later on.3. Exp tables - I will admit that the exp tables for this game seem rediculous at some times, especially when viewed in comparison to the original KR version. That being said, the fields, as well as the 15% exp medal obtainable from killing field bosses, alleviate this fairly well, and despite what many might try to tell you, NA does not have the worst tables. In the end, though, this is an MMO. What were you expecting?4. Cash Shop - Yes, we have a cash shop. The main value of the cash shop is for costumes, accessories and the like. There are items in there to let you bypass certain grinding quests for class changes and the like, but these aren't that big of an issue. There is one bigger issue, though, and that is the B-slot. Plainly stated, this item increases your skill holding section by 4 slots, which sounds like it would be a massive help. It really isn't all that much. Especially given that the field revamp made it possible to switch skills while in a dungeon, this item has become a luxury. On top of that, I've actually lost pvp matches becuase my mind couldn't keep up with the B-slot's additional buttons. Get it if you want it, but don't think it gives you a broken advantage ala play-to-win.5. Skills - This is the one most people who used to play the game before the revamp have issues with. Originally, you were limited by prereq skills rather than having to make choices. The end result was cookie cutter skill builds for everyone playing the same class. Under the new system, you have to pick one of two skills every five levels. Some people see this as limiting, but I feel it improves the uniquness of your character compared to the many others. That being said, KR recently implemented a multiple page system, allowing you to hold two skill pages where you can pick the other of the two options if you feel like it. All in all, a revamp was necessary given how the old system was abused, and for all the people who feel that classes they play are worthless now that they have to choose, I can only say I'm still enjoying my TT, who went from top tier to near bottom as a result. Deal with it.There may be more reasons people don't like the game, but all in all, most of them a tiny preferential things. This being said, there is no reason no to give this game a try, as although many of the afore mentioned people have attempted to "rage-quit" elsword, they have yet to find any game quite like it.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												elsword..... elsword elsword elsword.well there isnt much to saybut its your typical  pay to win type of game, but what i like about this game is that you can gain some items by just ranking up and getting them from quests.the animation and visual effects of the game is pretty good too, does feel like a comic book in a way. the beat em up mechs works fine too, but they need to put more combos into the characters since x and z are the only buttons to hit for swinging a sword or wand. theres also specials, but you need to level them up for able to take critical damage from them. one problom i have with the game tho is the limited storage space they give you when it comes to your inventory, if you want extra space, you need to buy it. the pvp in the game is ok, but will tire out your fingers if your not used to quick doging, speaking of which, its a skill you have to unlock, you only near dogeing tatic is by jumping or running away.the players on elsword are mostly quiet, rarely do you find people talking to each other, but when you do, its a guild thats doing so or a group of hipsters.but the game is quite exciting and enjoyable to play for a few hours, at first, leveling up is simple, but when you reach level 25 and higher, it slows down. not to mention some quests or equipment require a level to play or use.if you dont spend any money on the game, you can still enjoy it, but prepare yourself on spending time clearing your inventory alot, since you gather items like crazy.i would give elsword a 8 out of 10

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												My friend got me addicted to this game a while back and I really enjoyed it. There are lots of events and recent updates. PVP is pay to win but have real skill, max level, and decent gear you can win. I play games when I feel like and with all the constant changes I get overwhelmed and stoped playing. If you love anime and combo mmorpg's then this is for you.Pro's-Constant events and updates-Anime style graphics-High level max(currently lvl85)-Dungeons, Raids, and Fields/PVE-PVP seasons-Skills-Professions-Anime-Characters with first and second job change(aka class)-Pets-Items-Player market(list items for trade and buy items for sell by players)-You can get almost anything in game with standard currency(just need some connection)-AnimeCon's-Constant events and updates-Expensive premium currency/shop(about $40 for a costume on one character)-Pay to win pvp-Grinding for levels, gear, and items(one of the very few things I can't stand)-Hoplessly long questsReplay value: inf/10 ~ 2 addicting.Overall: 9/10 ~ Love this game too much. Hard to stop playing

												good game i have been reading some reviews of this game and none of them said that you can get most of P2W item with in game currency, some of them arent but you can gift them and the prices for them arent really that high you the most must buy item is skill slot B that cost aroun 70mil to to 120mil and taking into acount that you get 100+mil doing all story quest up to lvl 85 so you will get it and once you get really late gaem you can get easily about 200mil weekly so the game isnt a hard P2W taking into acount all of this.the good thing of this game-this game is unique there isnt a lot of game like this that isnt from the same dev-is fun to play and there is a lot of variety of classes to choose from-when you find people to with the game become a lot easierthe bad things about this game-this game is all about grind-this game is way to unbalanced you have classes that are garbage at everything they can do(im looking at you CrA ;w;) and others that are plently broken in everything they do(like luciel and ara)-lag-the community is mostly edgy kids and people that do a dungeon run while they wait to their league queue-the duns are repetitive and the aimations that at the start look amazing and inmersive are annoying later-bugs-dosnt have a banana weapon skin-the game dosnt even try to explian the most complex thing like socketing and enhacing-the tutorial is the most useless and annoying in this game -dosnt release some content because of money-having to run the same dun 3 and more times is boring

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
												This game could quite possibly be one of my favourite MMORPGs. My character has always been a DC Chung (LilSealand), and I've wasted plenty of hours on this amazing game. It's colourful, lively, and full of action. It's also loads of fun! However, I find it quite rigorous and annoying how you have to do all of these tasks just for job changes. Alongside this, I dislike how you have to spend real life currency on special items such as costumes. The items are far too expensive, in the first place! I also dislike how you have wait to be a certain level until you can do a certain quest. It kind of ruins the adrenaline of doing multiple quests in-a-row. Regardless, it's a nice game to chill with your friends and help each other out on quests. I love the characters and battles. The music and animation are also really gorgeous. Elsword is a beautiful and diverse game, just get ready for some minor cons and repetitiveness! :) Not everything's perfect, anyway.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
												I love this game, but I reccomend staying away from PVP as much as possible. I'm good at it, but that's because I find combos no one gets out of... and I got lucky enough to get gear that you really only get by paying real money. This game has a bit of a pay to win problem, so, between a player that spent only just 20 dollars and a player that uses just what they get and grind in game, the 20 dollar person will win. Even just costumes can give large stat bonuses, so, if you want to enjoy this game, don't fight other players unless you get REALLY, REALLY GOOD. Those pay to win ppl are so OP you'll want to throw out your computer.On a side note, this game used to be a lot more balanced, so you new players are kinda getting the short end of the stick here. :P

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												This is one of the most addicting games I've ever played. Perfect for both casual and hardcore gamers since this game has difficulty options for the dungeons and if one of the tasks requires you to play on a higher difficulty, you can party with players which takes the game to whole, new level. Unlike other MMORPGs, you can still succeed even if you're F2P. The characters in the game are unique, creative, and all possess different styles of play and to add to the game's replay value, you can attain multiple classes (or awesome new forms) for each and every character. YOU NEED TO PLAY THIS GAME.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												First off let me say that anime games and jrpg games are not usually my thing. I know this isn't a jrpg game but you get the picture. I tried this game because it was free and had action based combat. Turns out I love it. The graphics are anime graphics but in a good anime way. Very colorful, like video game candy on your TV. The characters/classes although gender locked, are fun to use, fight with and dress up. The community is very much alive. The dungeons get a little repetitive but that is tolerable because where this game really shines is the combat. It flows effortlessly from your gamepad/keyboard to your screen. Combos upon combos with specials upon specials. Whether beating up AI or fighting PvP in arenas.. it's all good in this one. I would recommend this to fans of anime, side-scrolling beat'em ups, even those who never really play this genre. It's fun and easy to get into.

It does the job it promises very well, it's a pure 10 for it's very unique design, and don't mix it with Maple Story, Elsword is a new century side-scroller, Maple Story is in a different league, Maple Story is a Legend, Elsword is a Rising Star. 10 out of 10 with not doubts about it's score.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												(This review will be edited over the course of Elsword updates)This game is so awesome:Pros:- 10 different characters to choose from, with 3 different job paths for each one, giving them a variety of different skills and playstyles- The leveling up for starters is uper fast, and once you get past level 30-40, the leveling gets more challenging- There's an Elsword website which keeps you updated on every single tiny thing added or announced, so that's awesome- A PVP (Player VS Player) Mode which pairs you up with a random player to battle- A dungeon mode you can play with friends or randomly matched people to complete in-game story quests- The characters' voices were originally in Korean, but now KoG is slowly revamping each character with some fresh new English voice lines, and they sound awesome!Cons:- The PVP system is kind of unfair, you always get paired up with some Elsword veteran who ends up demolishing you with an endless combo, but i don't really see any way to fix that- This game is kind of P2W, having you spend money on the in-game currency, K-Ching, to get the good costumes and stuffAside from that, the game is great! I totally recommend this! 9/10BANTHUS APPROVED.

												This game could quite possibly be one of my favourite MMORPGs. My character has always been a DC Chung (LilSealand), and I've wasted plenty of hours on this amazing game. It's colourful, lively, and full of action. It's also loads of fun! However, I find it quite rigorous and annoying how you have to do all of these tasks just for job changes. Alongside this, I dislike how you have to spend real life currency on special items such as costumes. The items are far too expensive, in the first place! I also dislike how you have wait to be a certain level until you can do a certain quest. It kind of ruins the adrenaline of doing multiple quests in-a-row. Regardless, it's a nice game to chill with your friends and help each other out on quests. I love the characters and battles. The music and animation are also really gorgeous. Elsword is a beautiful and diverse game, just get ready for some minor cons and repetitiveness! :) Not everything's perfect, anyway.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												It's an okay game with a nice amount of characters you can play as. Each of them can choose one of three classes to specialize in. The dungeons aren't terribly difficult early on (though the Secret dungeon which is essentially the area's bonus boss may murder you).The game is kinda cash-heavy. You don't need to spend any to play (though the Mana Necklace would definitely help. As will the Skill change medal for PvP) but the costumes/accessories they release tend to appeal to some people's cosmetic senses. Unless you're buying a limited-time rare outfit, you should wait til discounts around Black Friday/Christmas before buying anything. Your wallet will thank you.Sometimes the game will give you ways of earning free K-ching (their cash shop currency) so be sure to stay updated by checking out the site's news.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												I have played this game for awhile now +800 hrs, yes life wasted. This game can be pay to win for those people that waste hundreds of dollars to get +10,+11 for there weapon. Money is also wasted on skills, skill pages, pets, mounts, and costumes that are way over priced practically $25 just for one costume. PvE is somewhat repetitive, my only focus was PvP for that reason. Now PvP I recommend you stay away from it, its not worth the time to waste to get good. This is how practically every match goes, outplay the opponent the whole match than opponent gets one catch gg its over. PvP is filled with people that are gear carried especially in the higher ranks. Of course one would say just to get geared yourself but than another issue arises which is connection. This games connection in pvp is quite horrible I live in the U.S. I would get matched up with people in Europe or South America. Servers are bad practically every match is lag heaven. I dont mind getting destoyed by gear carried people and if it were just that issue I would recommend this game but the lag in PvP killed it for me.  If your willing to deal with the issues this games has than by all means download it and waste your life on it like I did trying to get decent gear in order to not get destroyed in PvP by laggy gear carried people. If your gonna stick to PvE than have some friends with you it would make it less boring and make it seem a little less repetitive. All in all its somewhat pay to win, with decent PvE, and PvP that would be great if I didnt always face someone from a different country.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												Money and Gear.What hasn't been said?.You'll need a lot of grinding and money in order to stand a fighting chance in the competetive scene.You need money to unlock slots for 4 more skills.You need money for seals to sell untradables.You need money to skip the grind.You need money to get ice burners to have a CHANCE at getting an awfully overpowered costume set.You need to do the above for the latest overpowered character if you're a tierfag.PvP is a (real-life) money sink.PvE is Maplestory.One of the only things you don't need money for and is useful, is the uninstall button.Be wary of it's bewitching aroma, for it will suck your money into a void as you just can't get enough, as it will give off a much foul aftertaste, but you just can't stop having it.Stay safe, do not try this meal.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												It's not a very in depth game, lacking much of a story and is repetitive when making multiple characters. That being said, this game makes up for it in it's simplicity of diverse skill trees and plethora of combos, especially if you just want to play a game every once in a while to fight on random monsters, find some items, make a party, or just kill time. It's not ground-breaking in this day and age, but for a free game in it's genre, it's definitely worth a play or two.

content:
Posted: January 16
												Honestly this game does get alot of well deserved flack, and for good reason, however because I have played alot and on two seperate servers, I will go into great detail why this game is worth your time, but not to much of your time.Firstly the combat is realitively simple to get to grips with, however the depth comes when applying skills, combos, and even class play styles and changes into the mix. Each character is fairly uniqe, minus the EL siblings, and all play diffrently to one and other.Elsword: standard sword play with a gauge that rewards you for switching your combo attacks and grants bonuses for skills, has a job path that increases sword skill, a job path that adds magic projectiles and fire to the mix, and a job path that gives you a second sword that can shred through enemys.Aisha: Standard mage, nothing much more then that, 1 job path gives you more elemental magic, the second one gives you some destructive dark magic, and the third one gives you "Kawaii Magic Girl" powers (this job is cancer in pvp)Rena: the ranger that will kick things, one job gives more arrow combos, one gives more kicks, the other gives traps and a sword.Raven (personal favorite): Slice enemys apart with your sword then blast em to peices with your Nasod (robot) arm, one job improves your Nasod arm punches, One improves you sword skills (recomended), and the final one gives you overheat abbilitys with various buffs and debuffs.Eve: comand various Nasod's with basic comands and use electricity to harm enemys, one job gives you servents, one job gives you tools of destruction (and a tank), and the third makes you shoop da woop.Chung: small kid with gaint dual end canon, you can smack the crap out of people or blow the up with canon fire. One job makes you smacking stronger, one gives you smaller lighter pistols while boosting your movement, and one gives you grenades mortors and a LOT of rockets.Ill finish writing this later and doing the other characters. overall worth your time so long as you dont go into pvp.

												Money and Gear.What hasn't been said?.You'll need a lot of grinding and money in order to stand a fighting chance in the competetive scene.You need money to unlock slots for 4 more skills.You need money for seals to sell untradables.You need money to skip the grind.You need money to get ice burners to have a CHANCE at getting an awfully overpowered costume set.You need to do the above for the latest overpowered character if you're a tierfag.PvP is a (real-life) money sink.PvE is Maplestory.One of the only things you don't need money for and is useful, is the uninstall button.Be wary of it's bewitching aroma, for it will suck your money into a void as you just can't get enough, as it will give off a much foul aftertaste, but you just can't stop having it.Stay safe, do not try this meal.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												I have played this game for awhile now +800 hrs, yes life wasted. This game can be pay to win for those people that waste hundreds of dollars to get +10,+11 for there weapon. Money is also wasted on skills, skill pages, pets, mounts, and costumes that are way over priced practically $25 just for one costume. PvE is somewhat repetitive, my only focus was PvP for that reason. Now PvP I recommend you stay away from it, its not worth the time to waste to get good. This is how practically every match goes, outplay the opponent the whole match than opponent gets one catch gg its over. PvP is filled with people that are gear carried especially in the higher ranks. Of course one would say just to get geared yourself but than another issue arises which is connection. This games connection in pvp is quite horrible I live in the U.S. I would get matched up with people in Europe or South America. Servers are bad practically every match is lag heaven. I dont mind getting destoyed by gear carried people and if it were just that issue I would recommend this game but the lag in PvP killed it for me.  If your willing to deal with the issues this games has than by all means download it and waste your life on it like I did trying to get decent gear in order to not get destroyed in PvP by laggy gear carried people. If your gonna stick to PvE than have some friends with you it would make it less boring and make it seem a little less repetitive. All in all its somewhat pay to win, with decent PvE, and PvP that would be great if I didnt always face someone from a different country.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												Elsword's leveling system is a blast. The combos. The skill. The mastery. It's all there.If you're into fast paced fighting games and want some casual character progression along with it, this game fits the bill.However PvP, the primary game mode for more competitive individuals, is plagued by lag. PvP runs via peer-to-peer connections, so if your opponent has a terrible connection, you're in for a bad time. Your competitive experience will be inconsistent, and you'll lose many matches along the way to the top due to internet connection exploits and general peer-to-peer nonsense.Casual PvE: A+Competitive PvP: C-

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												This game has been a favorite of mine for some time. Now normally i'm not really into side scrolling games but this game called out to me for some reason when I was on an MMO kick way back. I got into the game when it originally just had three classes. The swordsman, mage, and archer. The classes themselves are gender locked so people might not take kindly to that. I originally wasn't, but soon came to tolerate it. I moved my character around, edited some keyboard settings and felt right at home with how I adjusted things. The skill tree in this game is very unique and goes a long way as you "evolve" your class. Now, there are many different character classes to choose from and you can choose three seperate class "routes" you would like to take according to your play style. While for the pvp it seems like the gear is pay to win but I found myself able to win against higher level players at just level twenty or so with average gear. THe game plays fair, the story is nor more in-depth that it was before, and the gameplay mechanics run very smoothly even on my crap computer. All in all I would definately have to give this game a 9/10 for my personal score but for publi I would say it's a 7/10 due to not everyone liking the anime-style graphics and side scrolling gameplay.

Of course if you want to have a little more leisure and easy inventory managment the cash shop will help you.  In all a great game to try out and stick to if you like it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												Elsword is a fun game in general with surprisingly a lot of content.The side-scrolling style of gameplay makes the game unique from most other MMORPG's and is simple to navigate through. The game can be played either on the keyboard or on a gamepad; picking either one is based on preference. The story is quite interesting but if players are not interested, they can skip through the story if they want. Elsword has a variety of characters and class progressions so players can make themselves different from one another. As well as Skill Progressions, which make players even more unique. Leveling up your character is easy in the beginning and getting to your first class makes a small giddy feeling in some people. Leveling up becomes harder as you progress through the game and so do the monsters.The PvE aspect is quite interesting. The player can either find themselves playing in a Dungeon or in the Fields. Both have monsters and bosses. The level designs are very creative and shows that a lot of effort was put into making them. My favorite dungeon so far takes place in the town Lanox, "Ash Covered Village". Toward the last part of the dungeon, your party are left on a giant rail cart and the cart speeds down into the mines of the village which is in the background. Visually it is my favorite dungeon. The Fields are a good place to grind up on quests and leveling up your character.The item-revamp from earlier seasons made the Equipment system simpler. No longer were characters forced to find specific pieces of gear for a specific character-class. It became much much simpler. Organizing is easy and there is a "Organize" button if players don't feel like organizing themselves. Just don't spam the button. Crafting is also a necessity in the this game. Players can craft weapon, equipment, potions, etc. Players can also enhance their items through the Blacksmith which enhances your stats. Or players can give their gear some valueble elemental attributes which varies depending on individual playstyles. Players learn as they play through the game learning these aspects becomes a must.If players want to give their character some flash, they can spend real money in the Item shop. There are a large variety of goods in the shop. You can spend money to buy a pet, buy accessories, buy more inventory space, skill notes, customization options, the costume sets or the Ice burners that carry mysterious and rare goodies. However, in my personal opinion Ice Burners are not entirely safe to spend on for the goods that are found are ULTRA RARE statistically. Occassional events in the game are fun. They liven up the game somewhat and allow the player to gain some special items as well. And cool new stuff gets announced in the Item Mall. Best be on the look out!The most important aspect of the game would be the community. In Elsword, I found myself participating in almost every way I could in order to find and interact with other people. In one mode in particular known as Sparring mode, I found many different people speaking in these premade sparring rooms. Conversations are fun and are a joy to have. Guilds also offer many opportunities to speak with others and as a little bonus, that guild gives you buffs to help you through the dungeons. There are a lot of people in Elsword so players will be able to meet someone they can talk with. While there are some folks on Elsword that may be antogonistic, the majority of the people online are open-minded and refrain from being negative. Besides MMORPG's are best played with friends.Overall, like I said, Elsword is a fun game. It's constantly getting more and more content and has a very nice community.I would recommend this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												This game has been a favorite of mine for some time. Now normally i'm not really into side scrolling games but this game called out to me for some reason when I was on an MMO kick way back. I got into the game when it originally just had three classes. The swordsman, mage, and archer. The classes themselves are gender locked so people might not take kindly to that. I originally wasn't, but soon came to tolerate it. I moved my character around, edited some keyboard settings and felt right at home with how I adjusted things. The skill tree in this game is very unique and goes a long way as you "evolve" your class. Now, there are many different character classes to choose from and you can choose three seperate class "routes" you would like to take according to your play style. While for the pvp it seems like the gear is pay to win but I found myself able to win against higher level players at just level twenty or so with average gear. THe game plays fair, the story is nor more in-depth that it was before, and the gameplay mechanics run very smoothly even on my crap computer. All in all I would definately have to give this game a 9/10 for my personal score but for publi I would say it's a 7/10 due to not everyone liking the anime-style graphics and side scrolling gameplay.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
												I've really been struggling to find a decent enough game to play. Then, my boyfriend suggested going to the "Free to Play" games. Which I plum forgot about to begin with. SO! Afterwards I finally found this game called Elsword. Watched the little preview on the gameplay and I immediately wanted to play it. With my internet connection it took about an hour or so to download. I patiently waited for it to come to an end. I have been playing this game for close to 15+ hours now. It's new user friendly, the screen would otherwise seem overlycrowded. It has hot keys for everything and the gameplay is really captivating. I think everyone should give this game a go. I have been chatting with no other than friendly anime lovers such as myself. Everyones super helpful and the time I put into this game is definitely well spent. I've always used my xbox controller when playing most games on here. This game makes me feel comfortable enough to use my keyboard and all its buttons with confidence. Not to mention.If you're a girl or guy that gets quite the kick out of being able to fully customize your characters.This game provides. I know what most people think of free games that require you to actually buy virtual merchancise.But, this game has alot to offer. If you dont believe me at least give it a shot.After all, it is free.Isn't it.I probably won't ever stop playing this time. Not once, have I experienced any issues with installing, booting and the servers are always open.Did I mention you can have pets and mounts?!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												You like manga/anime themed art styles? Of course you do that's why you're here right? Ok anyways it's a very smooth 2.5D fighting game. Think mmo Smash Bros. (Has anyone played Viewtiful Joe)? But yeah the crafting system is pretty easy to get the hang of and the community is excellent so give it about an hour of play and see what you like after all it is free-to-play.  Speaking of which, lets talk about that for a sec, you dont need to worry about pay to win because this game showers you in events for all sorts of goodies. This can also be a negative thing though because your storage is, in my opinion, wayyyy to small to begin with. PvP is ALRIGHT not perfect though. I like to think of pvp as Super Smash Bros. with friends but with PRIZES. Also pvp lobbies are  used as a chatroom often so thats kind of cool. The game music is pretty freakin awesome by the way, you can tell they know what they're doing when it comes to setting the musical mood for a good butt kickin. Anyways back to the graphics the manga-themed aesthetic is really pleasent for anime fans to look at but  some of you simply might not enjoy that art style so it could impact your feelings, but hey, thats fine because if you're still reading this then chances are you already feel comfortable with the art.Another nice thing about this game is it doesn't take up much space on your hard drive. In fact it doesn't require you to have a super nice computer. Minimum requirements is 256MB of RAM and 32MB of VRAM. Cpu speed needs at least 800MHz.     Recommended however would be 512MB RAM 128MB of VRAM and 2.7GHz of Cpu speed. So I would probably give it a 8/10 for general judgement, and a 9/10 for my own personal biased judgement  (ANIME themed 2.5D fighter!)TL;DR  Anime Fighter like Super Smash Bros, but with PvE elements a good fighter game to take casually that also has a nice sound track.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												Honestly, this game at its core is just a fun game to play. I'm not a hardcore gmer with any game, by any means, but this is one of my favorites. The level design is pretty entertaining, and the story to the game is actually pretty interesting (if you actually pay attention to it). There are peple saying that the original characters in the game can't even stand up to the new ones in PvP, but I have to say that's a load of crap. I play thefourth character made, using the class with the lowest range(in the whole game), and I can easily kick butt no prob. The only problems with this game is the low inventory space, if you're a person who needs to keep every single item, this game is not for you, you can get through the game pretty easily without buying the extra space, but you'll do a lot of item discarding. Honestly, I would just say play the game, its really fun and will keep you entertained for quite a while.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												Firstly, please don't let my hours fool you, I have many hours spread over various accounts.Elsword is a side-scrolling MMORPG. It has a 2.5D perspective that works suprisingly well with the game's design.It features beautiful backgrounds and some platforming elements. Even if you don't like platforming games, giveElsword a go, I hate platformers, but I love Elsword.COMBATIn Elsword, the combat is simple, but complex. You use Z and X along with the arrow keys to pull-off combos and you have 4 skills to use. A S D C. You can also buy a BSlot to get 4 more Q W E R. You use your combos and skills to kill monsters and bosses through fields (Open areas where you kill monsters along with other random players) and dungeons (instances where you team up with 3 other players to clear a dungeon area along with a boss at the end.)Now, If you are looking for an ultra-balanced MMORPG with competitive PvE and PvP, please leave. Elsword at its heartis more of a casual game. To contradict myself, it does also contain many competitive aspects, just don't expect them tobe balanced.But, please don't mistake this as me saying this game is bad and only for casuals. Elsword is very, very addicting and enjoyable as long as you don't take it too seriously. In order to enjoy this game, you will need to spend *SOME* money, but, contrary to what many people say, you don't honestly have to spend that much money. There are a few things that are more-or-less neccessary such as inventory expansions, but they are very cheap if you have any sort of income whatsoever. Other things such as Ice-Burners (Premium Costumes) (Costumes are cosmetic items that can be socketed in order to increase your stats) are not needed, thus you don't need to spend money on them, but they help.This is where my previous statement comes in. Elsword is a breath of fresh air if you don't treat it like WoW or LoL etc.. Its enviroments are light and airy, the music is nice and relaxing, and it's very fun to kick back and enjoy a few friendly arenas on a Friday night. What I would say to you is, try out the game, see if you enjoy the core combat and skill system and, if you do, play it. Don't worry about class balance, don't get angry, just relax and you'll love this game.Here's a list of things you'll NEED to enjoy the game if you really want to commit to Elsword. (Cost after the :.)Inventory Expansions:  Roughly $20 per character.Skill B Slot: $9 per character (But you can buy VIP, $10/month to get B slot on every character for duration of VIP).Bank Slots: $~9Overall, if you really want to commit to Elsword, buying VIP is a good way to kickstart your leveling and get some temporary BSlots (Btw, BSlots allow you to equip more skills.)If you have any more questions about the game, either message me on Steam, or add me on Elsword. My IGN is Vjyorsk. I'd be happy to help with anything you need. (As long as I'm not busy :)). Thanks guys :) Enjoy the game, it's awesome!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2015
												Hello there. c: Well then, Where can I start? Elsword is a fun MMORPG game. Not the typical "Create your character the way you want it to look like!" Actually, that comes later. Instead, they give you several of characters to choose from, each having a different story, and three different routes to choose from. (Classes for example, If you choose Elesis, you have three Classes to choose from, each being different in their own special way, and having different combos.) The Good, Neutral, then Evil Route (In my opinion.) This is a slide scroller game, during Dungeons, and level grinding isn't that hard (During the weekends) Yet during the weekdays watch out from your Will/Stamina. Once you reach 0%, you may no longer play with that character. Yes you have the option to create more characters! Not just one, except there is a limit (I believe 6?) Now, as for customization, in this category it is a Pay - To - Win game. The customization gear comes with high stats to help improve your character to become "better" This is mostly used for PvP as well, yet in my opinion I would say to stay away from the PvP Community, because it's very cancerous (AKA stupid and annoying) If you're with friends, I would recommend this game because it's just really funny to see when people get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off. x'DFrom what I see in the community in general, if you don't pay to win, your character sucks. A lot.And it's true. For a B-Slot, you have to pay for that. If you mess up with your character skills, you have to pay for a restoration potion. Karma Koins are very expensive, seeing how $25 won't even give you a full costume. Probably a weapon and b-slot. Also, My IGN is Psychotropia (Or is it Psychotropic? I forget since I haven't played in a while.) I was a winner from one of Elsword's contests that they hold on their Facebook page. They gave me 400 K-Ching, which really isn't anything and you're most likely better off buying ice burners, yet that's gambling. So even 400 K-Ching won't get you anywhere. (That's saying something if you wanted to be cheap and input less money. Cause your wallet will most likely be empty if you play this game.)In short, Elsword is a Pay - To - Win game, I would recommend this game to those who don't mind spending money on a game. Eventually, you create a character, and you're bound someday or another to put in money. That's how I see it.I hope you guys have fun if you play this game. ; ^ ;

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												I've been playing this game for about half a year now, and to sum it up in a general statement: the game is enjoyable as a side-scrolling RPG.Pros.-overall good community-fast playthroughs concerning dungeons (good for beginning a new character)-Good amount of events-Dont have to empty your wallet in order to be good-good handful of characters which have multiple different play stylesCons.-KoG needs to do some balancing of characters for the NA servers, not quite as smooth for certain dungeons when with other players.-Since the merge of communities rowdiness in PVP has skyrocketed (Whining complaining hassling etc.)It's a game kids. Relax.-FPS gets a very glitchy especially in situations such as henir and 3P-V-3P (Solution for the earlier note: find a program to help your FPS increase, Cortex for example- it'll decrease the whining about "hackers" cause you're probably facing someone with a better pc or is using a program like so because they're sick of the glitching.)And finally: -yes, sometimes a quest can be too repetitive- yes this could also be a positive thing when it comes to earning locked skills and extras for those dedicated to a character for a guild or just a general favorite, but it can also hinder progress in certain parts of the storyline.However despite the minor negatives it is still a very enjoyable game, allowing you to create a character which really fits your play syle. Whether you're into pro/casual gaming means nothing towards recomendation for this game, either way it's still enjoyable, and hope you have a blast.Rating: 9/10

content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												I play this game for two years now (despite what my STEAM hours say). Honestly, I love the game. There is nothing like it. I main mage and archer character, and although they are mostly underrated because they are difficult to master, they are really fun. It is true that the game is kind of pay to win, but you can take advantage of events and you should be fine. I spend about 20 bucks on the game....not sure whether I regret it or not. I know there are a lot of not-recommends in this section because the balance is not exactly the best, and there are occassional lags in pvp. We've came to expect so much from this game that we get pretty upset if it doesn't meet our standards.The truth is, you won't play this forever. In fact, you might get bored in about a week, but this game does offer a great MMO experience. With only $20 spend, I would say that I am doing pretty well in the game PVP and PVE wise. I can go as far as SSS rank in pvp with just simple spar gear, but it does that time and experience with your character. I have made about 7 characters in the game that are all very useable. They are able to stand up to the game and all it's problems.Overall, this is a very good game. Try it out. It doesn't hurt. Don't pvp until at least lv 70. Take advantage of the events. I hope you find this review useful :)

content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
												(NOTE): This is just a quick personal reflection on the character progression and loot system of Elsword. I enjoy the game for a lot of reasons, but the customization system can be different...This game is really fun, the character customization and progression has little to no limits, and is very great. However, most of the gear you pick up from enemies is usually unusable, with all the added classes in the past few years, which makes the chances lower and lower of getting a usable item. Most of the time, It's a higher level than you, or It's just plain useless. The majority of gear obtained from enemies just looks flat-out boring, and the cosmetic shop, where you can purchase items with the real money paid currency, has a very big inventory. However, about $10.00 worth of the purchased in game cash(forgot the exact name) will get you 1 or 2 cosmetic items pernament. because you'll probably end up renting them for a month at a cheaper cost. You can ad a few select stats. just for a boost.

												Elsword's leveling system is a blast. The combos. The skill. The mastery. It's all there.If you're into fast paced fighting games and want some casual character progression along with it, this game fits the bill.However PvP, the primary game mode for more competitive individuals, is plagued by lag. PvP runs via peer-to-peer connections, so if your opponent has a terrible connection, you're in for a bad time. Your competitive experience will be inconsistent, and you'll lose many matches along the way to the top due to internet connection exploits and general peer-to-peer nonsense.Casual PvE: A+Competitive PvP: C-

												Hey I played Elsword for a long time. This game is actually pretty fun but it can be a climb on Mt Everest to get to lvl 60. Beautiful anime designing, graphics and gameplay. I can't wait for Lanox (Ranox?) and Lu/Ciel's release and I have high hopes for this game.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												This game has been a favorite of mine for some time. Now normally i'm not really into side scrolling games but this game called out to me for some reason when I was on an MMO kick way back. I got into the game when it originally just had three classes. The swordsman, mage, and archer. The classes themselves are gender locked so people might not take kindly to that. I originally wasn't, but soon came to tolerate it. I moved my character around, edited some keyboard settings and felt right at home with how I adjusted things. The skill tree in this game is very unique and goes a long way as you "evolve" your class. Now, there are many different character classes to choose from and you can choose three seperate class "routes" you would like to take according to your play style. While for the pvp it seems like the gear is pay to win but I found myself able to win against higher level players at just level twenty or so with average gear. THe game plays fair, the story is nor more in-depth that it was before, and the gameplay mechanics run very smoothly even on my crap computer. All in all I would definately have to give this game a 9/10 for my personal score but for publi I would say it's a 7/10 due to not everyone liking the anime-style graphics and side scrolling gameplay.
